What is Bitcoin?
What is Robocoin?
Where We Stand:

California Cryptocoin has taken the necessary regulatory steps in becoming legitimate operators of Robocoin Kiosks here in the State of California. Our goal, with your help, is to bring liquidity and legitimacy to a rapidly expanding Bitcoin market. Currently, this is where we stand:

• We have purchased 2 Robocoin Kiosks -- They will be placed in Los Angeles and/or San Francisco. We will provide updates of where our machines will be specifically located once leasing has been confirmed.
• We have applied for Money Transmission License -- This is a rigorous vetting process from the Department of Business Oversight which requires us to have a net worth of over $250k.
• We have additional licensing in order to preempt any Bitcoin regulatory stance the US government may take.
• We have scraped together $150k in startup from friends and family.
What this means is that we are roughly $50k short of having a $250k net worth as a company. This is the minimum for us to obtain the correct licenses, so we need YOUR HELP!
Where Does Your Donation Go?
The $50,000 that we are looking to raise from you all will give us the necessary company net worth and will be allocated to two places specifically:
• $10,000 cash will go in each Robocoin kiosk. This is so that there is cash in the machines for you guys to withdraw!! -- This adds up to $20k

• The remainder $30,000 will be deposited directly into our gateway exchange account (Bitstamp). This is so that when you place your order at CA Cryptocoin's Robocoin Kiosks, we can immediately place market orders on your Bitcoin. This allows for the seamless transactions of turning fiat currency into Bitcoin. (Please refer to ""Robocoin's Operation Scale"" infograph above for an easier understanding)
Donate With Bitcoin Below !!!
<h2 style=""text-align: center
column2: >We here at California Cryptocoin would like to thank you for all of your support! Thanks to you, Bitcoin can reach a higher level of liquidity and legitimacy in this world.

column1: <h3 style=""text-align: center
Or visit us at The California Cryptocoin Website

My name is Wanja Ngure. I am a Kenyan
human rights activist and VSO volunteer currently working with an NGO
in Malawi called Center for the Development of People (CEDEP). I have lived in
Malawi for over three years, and worked tirelessly as an advocate for the
rights of sex workers, vulnerable children, and LGBTQI individuals. My work at
CEDEP has comprised grant writing, overseeing monitoring and evaluation of
ongoing projects, advocacy, and implementing trainings and workshops. In this
capacity, I have grown especially passionate about working with sexual minority
populations who often face severe discrimination and violence in many African
countries. At CEDEP, <strong>I have been a key catalyst in expanding
programming for LGBTQI individuals living in Malawi. For example, I
founded a support group for lesbian and trans* identified individuals in
Lilongwe, providing them with a safe space for sharing challenges, learning
safe sexual practices, and coming to terms with their sexual identities. I am
proud to be part of the team that has pioneered the fight for the rights of sexual
minorities in Malawi.
I
have been accepted to a Master's programme in Human Rights at Kingston
University in London. I deferred my studies to, 2013, since I was not able to
provide the £12,000 pounds that were required by the institution. In 2013 i had
not raised enough fee hence could not make it to the graduate school. My
passion for activism and protection for Human Rights have given me the zeal to
continue and not to give up in search for this Masters. I wholeheartedly
believe that it is through learning about human rights that one is able to
respect, promote and defend them.<span>  In my
work I have realized that there are a great number of abuse cases which are
mostly caused by ignorance, greed and rigidity. We need people who are
passionate about human rights, who can defend everyone's human rights, and
facilitate in formulation and implementation.
It is now time for the next phase of my career as
a lifelong activist. <strong>In September 2014, I will commence a year-long
course of study at Kingston University outside London. This Masters of
Human Rights program will provide me with the technical and epistemological
tools needed to continue my advocacy and programming work. Specifically, I look
forward to being exposed to international perspectives on sexual minorities and
other pressing human rights issues I’ve become familiar with in Malawi and
forging networks with other organizations and individuals working in Africa
that will prove instrumental in the more global struggle to protect the rights
of sexual minorities. After completing my course of study at Kingston, <strong>I
plan to return to sub-Saharan Africa to continue my advocacy work
focusing on sexual minority populations living in homophobic contexts.
Although the cost of completing the Masters of
Human Rights degree is almost prohibitive for me, my passion drives me to
overcome this challenge. I have managed to save some funds from my small
stipend as a VSO volunteer in Malawi. I plan to work part time while completing
my degree at Kingston. Unfortunately, my family’s financial situation will not
permit them to provide me with support. I come from a small farming village in
central Kenya and I am one of six children. My dad passed away in 2012 and my
mother is a peasant farmer.
Here, I am requesting your financial support to
help me cover accommodation costs while completing my degree at Kingston.
Though I plan to live as cheaply as possible, my part time work will not fully
cover my housing costs and partial tuition fee. In this regard, I would most
appreciate even the smallest increments of financial support. Your support will
enable me to devote my time to my academic work while in the UK, and ensure
that I return to Africa most equipped to lead the struggle for LGBTQI and other
minority populations.
Thanks so much for your consideration. Please do
contact me if you have any questions about my plans, would like references from
my work or academic colleagues, or would like further information.
Asante sana.
Wanja Ngure
Email: wanjangure@gmail.com

THE CHANGEMAKERS TAKE D.C.!

The 8th Grade Students have worked
hard this year to make their learning applicable to the world around them. They
have participated in ambitious projects that showcase their hometown of
Detroit, MI – including writing letters to the mayor and studying the policies
affecting the city. This summer they would like to take their hard work to the
next level by traveling to Washington, D.C. for a week! This trip will help them gain
insight into the nation they live in and allow them to discover where policies
that affect their lives come from.
As changemakers, they feel it is time they get to see where
changes are made!
This will be the first time most of these students get to
visit the capital, and they are very excited for the prospect. Each student is
required to raise a certain amount of money in order to make their trip
possible. However, even considering their donations, the expenses remain quite

high. This is where you can help.

Your donations will go towards:
1) Lodging
2) Transportation to D.C.
3) Museum costs (The Crime and Punishment Museum and Ford Theater each require an
entrance fee)
4) Food
A small donation could go a long ways towards making these students’ trip a
reality. These future leaders are already working to improve their city and the
lives nearest them. Just imagine what they could do after this wonderful
experience!
On behalf of my kids, thank you for your time and interest. Please share this

news and help make this trip come true!

Our Story

Loving Fiercely is the collaborative effort of Laura Prudhomme and Erin Beattie. We are a unique amalgamation of the moving arts and bodywork, serving clients in group classes and private sessions for the past 5 years.

We are motivated by the need to create healthy connections and an empowering understanding of the human body through movement, yoga and bodywork. Our mission is to continue to blend these art forms and make them accessible to as many people as possible.
column2:
>In addition to offering highly therapeutic yoga and movement experiences, we are unique in our partnership. We are the ONLY duo  blending these two art forms (that we know of) in Seattle. 

Nestled in the lovely neighborhood of Madrona, Studio 1423 - 1423 34th Avenue, Seattle, WA 98122 - is a multi-use space where our work together can thrive and we can build a stronger narrative between movement and bodywork by housing it in a more cohesive space. To compliment our classes we will invite specialized practitioners who add to the diversity of our quality offerings and help build
column3: > our overarching theme of in-depth study and access to the tools of a sustainable, life-long wellness practice.
column5: >Support us up front, and we can support your health long term.

column1: • Therapeutic Align/Refine classes wherein you will receive alignment specific  yoga and movement instruction accompanied by skilled hands on assists.

• Align/Refine 8 Week Series offered to groups of 3 students. Our 8 week series offers an in-depth look at movement and bodywork following along the framework of Ida Rolf’s Structural Integration Series.
• Yoga classes that hold space for every body.

column3: Beattie as well as guest teachers working in a variety of movement and bodywork therapies.

column1: • Private yoga/movement sessions with Laura
• Bodywork and structural integration sessions with Beattie

What We Need

Studio 1423 is currently under construction. We will open our doors on January 1st, 2015 with a limited weekly class schedule, monthly offerings of Slow &
column2:
Low and the Align/Refine Series. Your contributions make a significant difference in our financial security in our opening weeks.  

Here are some things your generosity will help us do:

column1: • Build out the space
• Lay down a floating floor
• Purchase additional props
• Help us with marketing expenses so we can reach more people in need of our therapeutic yoga classes
• Ensure we can cover our rent while we are under construction
• Start us out on secure footing, knowing we will see your bright faces and beautiful bodies in class soon!

Other Ways That You Can Help

We recognize our community as one of great talent, intelligence and resourcefulness. If you have ideas, suggestions, special skills that you think might be helpful as we are opening our doors PLEASE reach out and let us know. If you participate in the broad landscape of social media you can also help by spreading the word about Studio 1423 and about our crowd-funding campaign.

Our mission is to continue to blend these art forms and make them accessible to as many people as possible. In addition to offering highly therapeutic yoga and movement experiences, we are unique in our partnership. We are the ONLY duo  blending these two art forms (that we know of) in Seattle. Nestled in the lovely neighborhood of Madrona, Studio 1423 - 1423 34th Avenue, Seattle, WA 98122 - is a multi-use space where our work together can thrive and we can build a stronger narrative between movement and bodywork by housing it in a more cohesive space. To compliment our classes we will invite specialized practitioners who add to the diversity of our quality offerings and help build our overarching theme of in-depth study and access to the tools of a sustainable, life-long wellness practice. Support us up front, and we can support your health long term. Our Services
Therapeutic Align/Refine classes wherein you will receive alignment specific  yoga and movement instruction accompanied by skilled hands on assists.

Align/Refine 8 Week Series offered to groups of 3 students. Our 8 week series offers an in-depth look at movement and bodywork following along the framework of Ida Rolf’s Structural Integration Series.
Yoga classes that hold space for every body.
Workshops with Laura & Beattie as well as guest teachers working in a variety of movement and bodywork therapies.
Private yoga/movement sessions with Laura
Bodywork and structural integration sessions with Beattie

The Goal
The purpose of this campaign is to make it possible for me to volunteer full-time for 6 months on three sister projects to WordPress: BuddyPress, bbPress, and GlotPress.
column2: >The focus will be solely on their continued maintenance, ongoing development, and evangelism.

column1: WordPress is more community than software, yet the software that powers the community has nobody concentrating on it full time.
column2:
>I want to change this.

With your support, I would like to continue to dedicate my career to all three projects while remaining an independent and impartial entity with a dedicated period of distraction-free time.

column1: About BuddyPress
BuddyPress provides social networking elements to a WordPress powered site, and is used to power WordPress.org community profiles. It's been downloaded over 2.3 million times.

When you post to make.wordpress.org, your posts and comments are funneled into your profile. When you participate in core development on Trac, that conversation and progress is tracked in your activity stream.
The badges you see on each member profile is actually a BuddyPress Group, and the profiles themselves (over 16 million of them) are all powered by BuddyPress.
About bbPress

Every time you use the support forums across the WordPress.org network of sites, bbPress is in the background making this possible. It's a modern twist on forum software and has been downloaded over 1.5 million times.

When you ask a plugin author a question, you're using bbPress to do it. When you browse the plugin and theme repositories, bbPress is the engine that powers those interfaces.

bbPress is also the de facto choice for WordPress powered support-forums for thousands of self hosted plugins and themes, because it integrates so nicely with WordPress itself.
About GlotPress
GlotPress is a collaborative, web-based software translation tool, and has enabled WordPress, BuddyPress, bbPress to be translated into 43 languages other than American English.

It's still a BackPress powered application that needs a fair amount of attention to port to using WordPress instead. With the plan being for all plugins and themes to use it soon, it's important GlotPress have someone to concentrate on improving it.

With WordPress 4.0, non-English downloads surpassed English ones for the first time ever, proving that GlotPress is a necessity for continuing to improve WordPress's global outreach. 

If you use WordPress, BuddyPress, or bbPress in a language other than English, you have GlotPress to thank for this.
Why This Matters

WordPress is an enormously powerful and influential project, not just for the internet, but for the entire world to democratize the way we communicate. Sometimes this means Earth-shattering journalism and reporting, other times it means sharing pictures of cats. What matters most is we have the continued freedom to use the software(s) for anything we dream of.

BuddyPress and bbPress are official sister projects because they complement WordPress's goals so nicely. Where WordPress handles communication, BuddyPress and bbPress handle communities, enabling groups of individuals to congregate, collaborate, and share their thoughts with one another under the same democratic ethos as WordPress.
GlotPress unilaterally enables WordPress, BuddyPress, and bbPress to grow into the rest of the non-English speaking world.
Achievements

WordPress currently powers about 23% of the top sites on the web, achieved via thousands of contributions spanning several organizations. Though the number fluctuates, there are sometimes 10 or more full-time developers staffed to work on WordPress (many of which whom I consider to be close friends and colleagues.)

BuddyPress, bbPress, and GlotPress, have not had anyone concentrating on their development full-time since 2008. Any progress has only been by virtue of volunteering time between obligations to clients and other full-time work. Despite this lack of focus, BuddyPress and bbPress are hugely active and wildly successful projects, and GlotPress is bursting at the seams with potential.

About Me

My name is John James Jacoby, and I've been the project lead for (and a lead developer of) both BuddyPress and bbPress since 2010. I worked at Automattic for 3 years on a wide variety of projects ranging from WordCamp.org to WordPress.com VIP, and also recently worked at 10up for just-shy-of 1 year where I directed their engineering team.
What I Need

I'm hoping to raise $50,000 USD to support myself, my family, and cover related expenses for a minimum of 6 months while I focus on improving BuddyPress, bbPress, and GlotPress.

All monies will go towards costs of living, fees from the campaign itself (9% to Indiegogo), and any travel costs for speaking or educational engagements directly related to these projects.

If the full goal is not met, don't worry... I will prorate the duration accordingly so I can focus full-time efforts for the longest period of time. Your contributions will still make a huge difference.
What You Get
By helping me achieve this goal of volunteering on BuddyPress, bbPress, &
<ul>
• Allow me to help build the WordPress.org community hub we have been talking about for years.
• Enable me to stay an independent and impartial party, financially backed by the community I aim to please and serve.
• Allow me to provide guidance and leadership to three amazing projects that hugely benefit from it.
More specifically, I hope to focus on:
<ul>

• Query and caching performance improvements to both BuddyPress and bbPress (to help them power the almost 20 million user profiles and the immense amount of activity going into them from all of the support forums)
<li>Media &amp
<li>Per-forum moderation in bbPress to help with plugin &amp

In an effort to remain as transparent as possible, I will document my experiences of what being sponsored by the WordPress community and volunteering on open source software full time is like. I will also blog weekly with updates on the results this campaign has empowered me to complete.
When Will This Happen?

This campaign will be running until December 11, 2014. When the campaign ends, I will break the total up into months and blog about the details. I expect to start immediately after, for the maximum amount of time allowed by your donations.
Why Me?

I discovered BuddyPress, bbPress, BackPress, and WordPress(μ) at about the same time in 2007. I wasn't very impressed by where they were but saw huge potential for what I could help them become. I started patching bbPress, BackPress, BuddyPress, and WordPress, which eventually led me into full-time freelancing and consulting in 2009 &
In November of 2010 I started at Automattic, originally focused on WordPress.org, switching to working on Jetpack, ending with code review, security &
column2: performance audits, and deployments on WordPress.com VIP.

column1:
I learned a lot, and made great friendships and relationships, but ended up far away from the software I am most passionate about.

I left Automattic to work at 10up, and after 9 months directing their engineering team, I made more friends and had a great career but was even farther than I'd ever been from the software that brings me the most joy. This campaign can change that.
<h3>Risks &amp
This campaign only exists to eliminate the biggest risks and challenges that prohibit me from succeeding
column2: distraction. I have spent the greater portion of the past 5 years distracted from the most important things in my life: family, balance, and the WordPress community.

column1: The things I am afraid of aren't unique to this campaign or it's goals. I'm afraid of a lot of different things, mostly that no one understands how important these projects really are (to WordPress.org, and the rest of the world) but with your help, we can make an enormous difference together.
Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not able to help financially, there's a ton you can do to help everyone else. Pass this campaign along to others, help out in the support forums, help build WordPress, BuddyPress, bbPress, and GlotPress, or just mention me on Twitter and say hi.
In Closing

WordPress has introduced me to so many amazing people and enabled so many great things in my life, I want to continue giving back for as long as possible. With your help, I can remain independent and impartial to commercial self-interests and bias influences while leading the initiatives for free &
column2: open online communication with BuddyPress, bbPress, &amp

column1: I was originally reluctant to the idea of raising money like this, and reticent about why money is ultimately necessary for me to continue to make this happen. Having put this together with the editorial help of a few friendly WordPress community members, I'm convinced it's the right approach, and am super excited to get started.

Thank you immensely for your support, and I look forward to what we will accomplish together.

WordPress currently powers about 23% of the top sites on the web, achieved via thousands of contributions spanning several organizations. Though the number fluctuates, there are sometimes 10 or more full-time developers staffed to work on WordPress (many of which whom I consider to be close friends and colleagues.)

BuddyPress, bbPress, and GlotPress, have not had anyone concentrating on their development full-time since 2008. Any progress has only been by virtue of volunteering time between obligations to clients and other full-time work. Despite this lack of focus, BuddyPress and bbPress are hugely active and wildly successful projects, and GlotPress is bursting at the seams with potential.About MeMy name is John James Jacoby, and I've been the project lead for (and a lead developer of) both BuddyPress and bbPress since 2010. I worked at Automattic for 3 years on a wide variety of projects ranging from WordCamp.org to WordPress.com VIP, and also recently worked at 10up for just-shy-of 1 year where I directed their engineering team.
What I Need

I'm hoping to raise $50,000 USD to support myself, my family, and cover related expenses for a minimum of 6 months while I focus on improving BuddyPress, bbPress, and GlotPress.All monies will go towards costs of living, fees from the campaign itself (9% to Indiegogo), and any travel costs for speaking or educational engagements directly related to these projects.

If the full goal is not met, don't worry... I will prorate the duration accordingly so I can focus full-time efforts for the longest period of time. Your contributions will still make a huge difference.
What You Get
By helping me achieve this goal of volunteering on BuddyPress, bbPress, & GlotPress full-time, you will:
Allow me to help build the WordPress.org community hub we have been talking about for years.
Enable me to stay an independent and impartial party, financially backed by the community I aim to please and serve.
Allow me to provide guidance and leadership to three amazing projects that hugely benefit from it.
More specifically, I hope to focus on:

Query and caching performance improvements to both BuddyPress and bbPress (to help them power the almost 20 million user profiles and the immense amount of activity going into them from all of the support forums)
Media & Attachment support in BuddyPress
Per-forum moderation in bbPress to help with plugin & theme moderation on WordPress.org.

In an effort to remain as transparent as possible, I will document my experiences of what being sponsored by the WordPress community and volunteering on open source software full time is like. I will also blog weekly with updates on the results this campaign has empowered me to complete.
When Will This Happen?

This campaign will be running until December 11, 2014. When the campaign ends, I will break the total up into months and blog about the details. I expect to start immediately after, for the maximum amount of time allowed by your donations.
Why Me?

I discovered BuddyPress, bbPress, BackPress, and WordPress(μ) at about the same time in 2007. I wasn't very impressed by where they were but saw huge potential for what I could help them become. I started patching bbPress, BackPress, BuddyPress, and WordPress, which eventually led me into full-time freelancing and consulting in 2009 & 2010.

In November of 2010 I started at Automattic, originally focused on WordPress.org, switching to working on Jetpack, ending with code review, security & performance audits, and deployments on WordPress.com VIP.

I learned a lot, and made great friendships and relationships, but ended up far away from the software I am most passionate about.I left Automattic to work at 10up, and after 9 months directing their engineering team, I made more friends and had a great career but was even farther than I'd ever been from the software that brings me the most joy. This campaign can change that.
Risks & Challenges
This campaign only exists to eliminate the biggest risks and challenges that prohibit me from succeeding
column2: distraction. I have spent the greater portion of the past 5 years distracted from the most important things in my life: family, balance, and the WordPress community.

column1: The things I am afraid of aren't unique to this campaign or it's goals. I'm afraid of a lot of different things, mostly that no one understands how important these projects really are (to WordPress.org, and the rest of the world) but with your help, we can make an enormous difference together.
Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not able to help financially, there's a ton you can do to help everyone else. Pass this campaign along to others, help out in the support forums, help build WordPress, BuddyPress, bbPress, and GlotPress, or just mention me on Twitter and say hi.
In Closing

WordPress has introduced me to so many amazing people and enabled so many great things in my life, I want to continue giving back for as long as possible. With your help, I can remain independent and impartial to commercial self-interests and bias influences while leading the initiatives for free & open online communication with BuddyPress, bbPress, & GlotPress.

I was originally reluctant to the idea of raising money like this, and reticent about why money is ultimately necessary for me to continue to make this happen. Having put this together with the editorial help of a few friendly WordPress community members, I'm convinced it's the right approach, and am super excited to get started.
Thank you immensely for your support, and I look forward to what we will accomplish together.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","East Troy, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/buddypress-bbpress-glotpress-development/pica

We are contacting you today to ask for your support in our 6th Annual SPADA-thon to benefit PACE Center for Girls and the building of the new Golisano Children’s Hospital of SW Florida.
PACE is a non-profit organization that provides a non-residential program for at-risk girls in locations statewide, targeting the unique needs of females 12 to 18 years of age who are identified as dependent, truant, delinquent, runaways or in need of social service and academic help.
The Golisano Children’s Hospital of SW Florida will be opening in 2017 on the grounds of HealthPark Medical Center. The hospital will provide 128 beds with the ability to expand to 160, 36 pediatric acute care beds, 64 neonatal ICU beds, 16 pediatric ICU beds and more!
On May 19th from 4 - 8pm, SPADA Salon &
column2:
Day Spa will be hosting our 6th Annual SPADA-thon where we aim to raise $30,000 and collect as many dresses as we can for Love That Dress 7. The day includes various spa services such as wet hair cuts, kids cuts, manicures, waxing, massages , etc., all for donations starting at $5. The rooms in the spa are also transformed into mini boutiques where various vendors will set up shop and supporters can purchase merchandise that will offer a percentage back. Also includes tarot card readings, chakra balancing, a DJ and catering.
We are requesting your support by either being a sponsor, making a cash donation, donating an auction item and/or attending the event on May 19th.
Thank you for your consideration and we look forward to having you as part of this very worthy and fun event. If you have any questions, please feel free to contact us at 239.482.1858.
Sincerely,
The SPADA Team

www.spadaspa.com

Hey Everyone!

Over the past two years, I've been fortunate to teach in a low-income school in Los Angeles.  Times are hard, and our students have been unable to afford many basic school supplies.  (100% of our students receive free or reduced-price lunch.)

I want to continue to be able to ensure that I provide the very best I can for all of our students.  That's where you come in!

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

I've spent many, many dollars on behalf of our students.  Among other items, funding here will provide reimbursement for

column1: • a composition book for every 7th and 8th grade student ($1.14 per book, for 179 students)
• posters tracking each student's academic progress (~$5.00 per chart)
• three-ring binders for each student ($1.47 per binder, for 179 students)
• printer paper for photocopies for 179 students (approximately 1 box of 10 reams used per month for 10 months each year, $25.79 per box)
• smaller expenses for student items (poster paper, lamination costs, pencils, stickers, erasers, boxes of tissues)

I am looking for $800 to cover these expenses.  The beautiful thing about this is that ALL funds will go directly toward these educational expenses, regardless of whether we reach the $800 goal or not. 

The Impact

I can't emphasize enough how much a contribution would mean to our students and me.  We are in a tough economic climate, and every dollar counts.
• Our students try their best every single day to improve themselves and our world.
• They are some great kids, 11-13 years old, and would love your help.
• You'll get a thank-you note from me.

Other Ways You Can Help

It would be so awesome if you could let other people know about this campaign.  I know you guys are the best!

Thanks everyone for reading this!  Hope you're having a great day!

My name is James Lawton.  I am currently a student a Philadelphia Electric Charter school and a graduate of Mastery Charter Harrity Middle School where I was one of the top students in my class.  I grew up and live in West Philadelphia.  I attend school in a failing school district and would love to have the opportunity to further my academic and athletic future at a great school.  I am a straight A student and I love basketball.  I believe hard work is the key to a great future and I never stop striving to achieve my goals.  

I've recently been accepted at an expensive private boarding school and I would love to go.  I've received the full financial aid available but this leaves me with almost 6500 in tuition I would need to attend the school.  With the help of my former coaches and teacher, Larry Maley, I have set up this site in hopes that people will donate to my education fund.  

With their help we've received some Philadelphia 76ers tickets and memorabilia that we hoped to raffle to anyone who donates.  We have noticed that the law prohibits us from doing a raffle as a result of your donation.  Instead Mr. Maley and I have decided to donate the perks according to the time and amount donated. Below you will find what we are offering if you donate to my education fund. I know that you could probably buy them from the box office, but remember, its a great cause!!  I wish we could offer more!  Thanks for your help!!

Short Summary

Project Cambodia was started by some grade 9 students at Ecole McTavish in Fort McMurray, Alberta, Canada. It went from being a small project for a classroom assignment to being the full time fundraiser that the school has adopted as their main yearly fundraiser. We are lucky enough to have teamed up with two former educators (Janice and Amgad Rushdy) from Fort McMurray who volunteer up to 6 months a year at this particular school and will be helping us make sure the money goes directly to the building of this new school.

Our ultimate goal for this campaign is to raise $20 000 per classroom to build a brand new school for the students of Gems International in Battambang, Cambodia. We realize that this will be a multi year campaign to try and build this school, but we are committed to doing our best to raise that money as quickly as possible.

The students and staff at Ecole McTavish believe it is important to do what we can to make the World a better place. Through this campaign we wish to make a change and try to provide a better education to the youth of Cambodia. As Nelson Mandela once said, ""

is the most powerful tool you can use to change the World.” 

Your donations will change the lives of children in Cambodia and give them a chance at a better future, a better future that starts with the opportunity to get a proper education!


What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

Our ultimate goal is to raise $20 000 per classroom to build a brand new school for Gems International in Battambang, Cambodia. We are working in co-ordination with two former educators (Janice and Amgad Rushdy) from Fort McMurray to make sure all money raised goes directly to the building of this new school. Janice and Amgad Rushdy volunteer up to 6 months a year at this school doing what they can to improve the educational environment at this particular school. 

We have some perks that we have set up to show our thanks to the donors. For donations of at least $25 dollars, the project managers of Project Cambodia will email you a personalized ""Thank You"" to show you our appreciation. Donors that are willing to donate at least $1000 will be thanked personally on our Twitter and Facebook Page as well as have their names added to a ""Donor Wall"" upon completion of the new school.
column12:
>The Impact

Your generous donations will help change the lives of children and their families in Cambodia. An education will help provide children with an opportunity for a better future...a better future for them, their family, their community and their country. 


Other Ways You Can Help

To further help us towards our goal of building a new school for Gems International, we appreciate your help with the following:

column1: • Please tell others about our campaign and ask them to like our Facebook Page.
• Indiegogo also has share tools where you can tell others about our campaign and how to contribute...please spread the word :)

Northside is my home.  I was born at Allegheny General, lived on Howard Street and Raised in Northview Heights.  I attended NVH Elementary, Latimer, McNaugher, Perry &
column2: CCAC. My roots are in the Northside. My dad was also born and raised on the Northside.  My grandparents, great-grand parents, aunts and uncles lived on Armandale Street since the 1920’s.  I owned a video store in Perry Hilltop in the 90's and I currently unify Northside natives through my events like Grazin In The Grass (NVH), Northside Skating Parties also the Perry, Oliver &amp
column3:
Allegheny High School Reunions.

It is a

column1: community in need of uplifting. It's populated and prosperous past, has slowly
dissipated over the years in the name of progress.  The need to attract
new business, residents and visitors to the historically rich area is vital to
its survival. Our goal is to preserve &amp
instill a new sense of pride.
Thanks to the power of the internet we've been able to
gather a collection of Allegheny City &amp
column2: Northside photos and relics.They cover a span of over 150 years.

column1: Currently the images and objects are very popular on the internet and have even
sparked many reunions. As a result we have decided create a physical location
to put them on display. The Allegheny City Historic Gallery
will be the ultimate Northside visual experience.  It’s actually more than just a gallery, it’s
more of a museum or learning center. It
is free to the public, and a place for Northsiders to reconnect with friends
and family.
The Allegheny City Historic Gallery is a non-profit venture
partnered by myself, Kim Gandy and City Council Woman Darlene Harris.  It will be located on Historic East Ohio
Street. The collection is a collaboration
of public &amp
column2: private images and also objects.  It has become a community project because many of the images and objects

column1: on display were donated by past &amp
column2: present Northsiders, as well as the

column1: Allegheny City Society. So far we’ve
raised $12,000:  7,000 from the URA, 5,000 from the City. This
will help keep us open for 6 months, but it’s not enough to pay for all the
gallery functions and administrative costs. Plus we believe the Gallery should be a permanent fixture in Northside’s
landscape, because history and change happens daily.  We need your help to make this a
reality.
Gallery Special Projects
Kim’s Color Creations
- Our Photoshop expert Kim (Swiss Miss) Gandy adds a new dimension to the
historic experience by bringing color to the past.  Great care and research goes into every
colorized photo to make it as authentic as possible.
Federal Street &
Allegheny City Films
– We currently have a YouTube page featuring videos of Northside Historians and
Photographers.  These videos have
hundreds of views already.  Our next goal
is to create short, historically accurate reenactments of the Northside’s/Allegheny
City’s past.  Our video expert Willy
James plans to bring the past to life with short videos featuring an all Northside
cast.
Follow this link to our Allegheny City YouTube page to see all of the videos. http://www.youtube.com/user/AlleghenyCity
Here
are a couple of our historical videos for your viewing pleasure...  Take a
tour of Central Northside in the 60's and 70's with photographer Bob
Rathke.

<div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe class=""embedly-embed"" height=""326"" src=""https://cdn.embedly.com/widgets/media.html?src=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fembed%2FY28BcIMzi_c%3Ffeature%3Doembed&amp
Architectural Historian Carol Peterson, who co-authored a book
called ""Allegheny City"" with Steelers president Dan Rooney, takes Bill
Gandy on tour in Historic Arch Street and surrounding buildings.

<div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe class=""embedly-embed"" height=""326"" src=""https://cdn.embedly.com/widgets/media.html?src=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fembed%2FHRhVrcFACkE%3Ffeature%3Doembed&amp
Lego Project - We want to get the neighborhood children involved
also.  We would work with them to rebuild 1960’s Federal Street with
Lego Blocks.
Gift Shop -
Our gift shop will allow visitors to purchase T-Shirts, Historical
Books, Authorized photo re-prints and other souvenirs.  Many of the
books were written by Northside &amp
and historical societies, photographers and entrepreneurs.
Special Events - The Gallery has special events already lined up from Book
Signings with Steelers President and Allegheny City native Dan Rooney &amp

Architectural Expert Carol Peterson promoting their book “Allegheny City”.

Risks &
column2:
Challenges
The 1st challenge was raising initial funding.  That has been overcome.  The next challenge was finding a suitable location. That too has been overcome.  Our challenge for the future is becoming a permanent fixture on the Northside, and raising enough funding to sustain the gallery for time to come.  This Indiegogo is one of our solutions, as well as submitting for grants.

column1:
Other ways you can help
Please share our campaign and help spread the word.  We are also looking for items such as furniture, frames, album books and Lego's.

We want
YOU on our team!  Team

FUSION robotics team.  Team Fusion competed at the Western Super Regional (WSR) and placed 8th out of 36 teams in the Gold Division (top 22%).   While FIRST announced that Team Fusion had achieved advancement to Worlds, this was later retracted by FIRST and Team Fusion is now an alternate for advancement to Worlds. 

  • Watch our Promote video (Finalist at WSR):http://youtu.be/1sm4NH1SOHY
  • Watch Fusion 135 compete at WSR: http://youtu.be/b9cqfJ20GO0
• Click on the Gallery tab above to see pictures of Fusion 135 at WSR!
Our team is one of just a few teams out of 36 teams that competed at the
San Diego Regional Competition that was selected to compete at the Western Super
Regional tournament!    We’ve
worked very hard to get this far, but now we need support for our accumulated travel costs!
The
concept behind FIRST and the FIRST Tech Challenge program is to build a new
robotic creation each year designed to meet a new game challenge.  While building the robot, the team members
learn basic engineering and problem solving skills, team dynamics, business
concepts, and how to overcome obstacles.
Completed robots are driven by the FIRST teams in a series of competitive
events leading up to a final World Competition held in St. Louis, MO.  This program is an awesome way for America’s
students to become motivated in STEM fields!

actively supporting and mentoring the junior
scientists and engineers of the future!

column2: >*At this time I have received funding from my university to go to LA! However, I still need your help! The source of the funding has asked me to continue raising money to lower the cost of what the university has to pay. I also have no money for food for the trip and would love to be able to eat while I'm out in California!*

column1: Here's why I need you...
<h3><span style=""font-size: 16px
column4: >My name is Kelsey Gilchriest and I am currently pursuing a career in Deaf theatre. My university does not offer American Sign Language classes, only Sign Language (which is Sign Exact English and is different than ASL), and still sees Deafness as a disability, not as a culture or community. My goal, in the time I have left at James Madison University, is to change that. I'm fighting for ASL to be considered a language in our Foreign Language Department
column5: I'm proposing to direct a play with Deaf characters
column6: and I'm trying to get one performance per show interpreted every season in our theatre department. In order to make this change, I need funding  in the amount of $1,000 to be able to go to Deaf West Theatre in Los Angeles. This money will be used for airfare, lodging, and meals while I'm in the city.

column1: <h3><span style=""font-size: 16px
column4: >Deaf West Theatre has radically changed how the hearing world sees the Deaf world. Suddenly Deafness is seen as beautiful
column5: American Sign Language is seen as an art form. And most importantly, Deaf West has shown this country how hearing and Deaf can come together and make something beautiful and powerful. This is why I need your help. Deaf West will help me change my school into a more inclusive place. Our campus is so unaware of the culture they are missing out on...most students don't even know that the Virginia School for the Deaf and Blind is 20 minutes from our campus. Help me change the way my hearing school views the Deaf community. Deaf West can (and will) help me achieve this.

column1:
Other Ways You Can Help

     Just because you can't contribute monetarily, that doesn't mean you can't help:

• Help me get the word out and make some noise about my campaign!! The more people who know, the better!
  • Feel free to share this link on any social media you want! There's no such thing as too much publicity.
• Let's make a change. Change starts with a whisper, but turns into a roar. Let's roar!

About SHRED

The SHRED Foundation is harnessing the unifying power of snow/skate culture to inspire an alternative path for young people considering non-traditional career opportunities. By partnering with local stakeholders  (organizations, schools, local
recreation departments, snow/skate companies, reps, shops, mountains, and brands), SHRED will provide apprentice programs for youth who are interested in pursuing
potential careers outside of traditional routes. SHRED values the importance of teaching its youth the core aspects of the
culture, which include individuality, creativity, progression,
entrepreneurial drive and community.

The foundation was created by Danny Hairston, former Senior Program Manager for Stoked Mentoring and former Fundraising and Event Coordinator for Burton Snowboards' Chill Foundation. Danny is an avid snowboarder and has worked for ten years helping to write curriculum and implement youth development programs utilizing boardsports.
<h3>What We Need &amp
column2: What You GetStart-up funding to get SHRED's programming off the ground! Year one, we will focus on Poughkeepsie, NY and Rochester, NY. The Poughkeepsie school district

column1: is in the bottom 5% statewide, and the poverty rate is 157%
greater than the state average (85% greater than the national
average). Rochester is the fifth poorest city in the nation with half of
the children there living under the poverty level. By offering an alternative career path, SHRED is broadening an otherwise narrow path for youth in traditionally impoverished areas.

With that said, we're doing it all for the kids! In order to accommodate their needs, we will be applying funds to transportation, insurance, lift-tickets, equipment, and general supplies.

What you get for helping....
<ul>
<li>Super good karma<span style=""background-color: initial
The Impact
The SHRED Foundation is built upon three major pillars “Fear, Fail, Flow.”
These pillars exemplify the basic aspects of the culture by cultivating
risk taking, progression through failure and, finally, style, joy and
freedom which comes from the mastery of snowboarding and skateboarding.
Our intent is to honor the history and to, above all else, maintain the
authenticity and integrity of the culture that we love. We will remember
to always allow that to guide us in what we endeavor to do to help
change the lives of those we look to serve.
Other Ways You Can Help

Share, share, share! Help us get the word out about SHRED's mission! (Psst, Indiegogo has great ""Share"" functions to help you do this!)

Short Summary

This campaign is really simple. My 12 year-old daughter Riley has been through swimming lessons at the Odawa Native Friendship Centre Program since she was a baby. Two years ago when she expressed an interest in competative swimming the first year was financially manageable and we did our best for her second year after seeing how much she liked it and seeing how good she was it. We discovered that she is really, really good at competative swimming and that she really loves it.

column3: >This year, the swim fees are going to cost us $3600 (plus there will be swim meet fees and traveling expenses among other things). Her dad wanted to tell her that she will have to sit this year of swimming out but I just can't bring myself to tell her that. I'd rather ask for financial assistance this way to do what I can to make it work than give her this news.

>Last year she was a really dedicated swimmer and her hard work and passion for swimming has really given her focus in school and the confidence to join other sports like running, triathalons and pretty much every other sport that her school has to offer!

column1: All together the fees are going to cost $3600. We need $511 by tomorrow plus a new bathing suit which is about $80 or so. The first goal for this campaign is $600 (first set of swim fees, bathing suit and Indiegogo platform fees).
I'm going to take her to her first swim practice tomorrow regardless is we have payment or not and ask for a payment extension until the end of this week so I have time to raise the money.
After this week, I will have another compaign to raise money for the rest of her lessons. I just need to give the swim team confidence that I can pay for the first week.

• My name is Jaime Koebel, I am the mother of a set of twins (Hunter and Riley who are 12 years old and will be 13 in a few months. I also have an 11 year old son). I'm an artist and will use that skill to help raise money for her swimming. 
  • We missed most of the fall deadlines for all of those amazing sport grants out there so this is the next best thing. Now that we know that the Dreamcatchers Fund and others exist, we'll be more prepared for next year!

We will make sure to post updates on how she is doing at swimming and her progress over the year! Riley doesn't know I'm doing this but I think the most important thing for her to know is that she gets to go to lessons. Riley has a goal to attend NAIG (North American Indigenous Games) in three years and it's really best if she doesn't sit even one year out. She can do this! We can do this!

If you can't assist financially: 

    We understand! You can still help us by sharing this campaign with others! In advance, thank-you so much for helping us out.

Her dad wanted to tell her that she will have to sit this year of swimming out but I just can't bring myself to tell her that. I'd rather ask for financial assistance this way to do what I can to make it work than give her this news.

Last year she was a really dedicated swimmer and her hard work and passion for swimming has really given her focus in school and the confidence to join other sports like running, triathalons and pretty much every other sport that her school has to offer!

All together the fees are going to cost $3600. We need $511 by tomorrow plus a new bathing suit which is about $80 or so. The first goal for this campaign is $600 (first set of swim fees, bathing suit and Indiegogo platform fees).
I'm going to take her to her first swim practice tomorrow regardless is we have payment or not and ask for a payment extension until the end of this week so I have time to raise the money.
After this week, I will have another compaign to raise money for the rest of her lessons. I just need to give the swim team confidence that I can pay for the first week.

My name is Jaime Koebel, I am the mother of a set of twins (Hunter and Riley who are 12 years old and will be 13 in a few months. I also have an 11 year old son). I'm an artist and will use that skill to help raise money for her swimming.  We missed most of the fall deadlines for all of those amazing sport grants out there so this is the next best thing. Now that we know that the Dreamcatchers Fund and others exist, we'll be more prepared for next year!

We will make sure to post updates on how she is doing at swimming and her progress over the year! Riley doesn't know I'm doing this but I think the most important thing for her to know is that she gets to go to lessons. Riley has a goal to attend NAIG (North American Indigenous Games) in three years and it's really best if she doesn't sit even one year out. She can do this! We can do this!

column1: <div>My name is Jasmin and I just completed a Masters degree in Psychology.  My masters was such a wonderful experience and I am so excited about continuing my education.  I am particularly interested in Neuropsychology and Forensic Psychology.   <span style=""background-color: initial

The Johnson &
column2:
Wales University Ad Team is at it again!

After placing first in the District 1 National Student Advertising Competition for the past four years, we're ready to head back up to Boston to defend our title.

Every year the American Advertising Federation sponsors the National Student Advertising Competition which brings together universities from around the nation to pitch their marketing campaign for the client (this year, Pizza Hut). The client gives us a real business challenge and budget, and we are judged on our research, strategy, and creative executions in a 26 page plansbook and a 20 minute presentation.

We've worked over 2,000 hours to develop the best possible campaign for Pizza Hut.

What We Need &
column3:
What You Get

In order to compete, the JWU Ad Team travels to Boston for one night. This is obviously a costly endeavor (hotel, parking, etc.) and that’s why we’re asking for your help.

100% of the funds you help us raise will go towards funding the trip to Boston.

Not only will you receive recognition for your help, but you can also get a signed photo, a DVD of our presentation, or even a video of the team serenading you personally! (Why not all of them?)

The Impact

Your contribution not only will make it possible for us to compete in Boston, but it will help cultivate the next Ad Team.

Johnson &
column4:
Wales University has a strong reputation both in New England and around the nation. You're helping build that reputation by providing much needed support during our shining hours.

Don't forget
column5: this campaign and team is as close as it gets to being in a real ad agency. This unmatched experience is a valuable asset to the Johnson &amp
column7:
Marketing Communications Program, and you're helping to keep it afloat.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is able to contribute cash, so the least we ask is for your help in getting the word out. Spread this campaign to all of your Facebook friends, your Twitter followers, and your friends and family. You can even come see the presentation On April 10th at Simmons College. Help us get to Boston!

Spring Break in New Orleans
We are a group of Urban Planning, Public Policy and Social Welfare, and Public Health Master's students at UCLA.

We are taking a trip to New Orleans over Spring Break 2015 to study the themes of city resilience and social equity. To do this, we will explore issues connected to public health, environment, economic development, arts/design and culture during three phases of New Orleans: history of New Orleans, Hurricane Katrina and rebuilding, and post-Katrina. While we will not focus exclusively on Hurricane Katrina and “natural disasters,” this is a main point in our trip as we examine how the city is able to survive and thrive.

During our trip, we will meet with members of the New Orleans Urban Planning Department, the Redevelopment Authority, and local grassroots art and urban agriculture organizations, to name a few.

After the trip, students will return to Los Angeles with a comprehensive report and presentation to the UCLA community to help integrate New Orleans policy, planning and health issues into our field curriculums.

What We Need to Get There!

Travel, housing, meeting, and food expenses for this trip add up, and though we have done a great job at keeping a tight budget, not all students can afford to go to New Orleans. We're hoping to raise at least $1,500 to go towards plane tickets and housing. Please help us make this an equal opportunity for all students to engage in this incredible learning experience, who will return to Los Angeles with enhanced community development knowledge.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are not able to contribute financially, there are plenty of ways you can help! Stay up to date on our trip by following our upcoming blog, and spread the word about our campaign on social media.

column1: Donkey-Ear“ on the island of Le Sél: with grey , stubborn animals, prickly
balloons, professors of emotion and lots and of books and tales. The book is
about reading, donkeys, dog-ears, donkey-ears and of course very much about
love. Sandro does not really like Sanja. She is much to clever and most of all,

","Book
project::
„Eine Kleine Geschichte über die Liebe“
a small
Story about Love""
A Small Story About Love“ will be  a book for
children aged 8+ and
the project is about financing a bilingual version in german and english.
Author:
Peter
Bosch
Artwork:
Alexandra Bolzer
Typography:
Nele Focke
The STORY:
Each year, there ist the „Festival oft the
Donkey-Ear“ on the island of Le Sél: with grey , stubborn animals, prickly
balloons, professors of emotion and lots and of books and tales. The book is
about reading, donkeys, dog-ears, donkey-ears and of course very much about
love. Sandro does not really like Sanja. She is much to clever and most of all,
she is a girl. But the prickly balloon likes Sanja all the more. Unfortunately,
he cannot talk and tell her…
This book combines three artistic fields:
The text (Peter Bosch) combines
realistic with imaginative elements, everything is familiar and yet a bit
different, out of place.
The illustrations (Alexandra
Bolzer) evolve from the story, complement the story elaborately and take you by
surprise with a diversity of different styles and materials.
The typography (Nele Focke) has
its autonomous role, makes references to the illustrations and the text as well
and so creates an additional visual and aesthetic layer.
Why should you support this
project?
Everybody who can still
remember how inspiring childrens' books can be and how much pedagogical value
good children's literature has, should support this project.
What happens with the funds after successful
financing?
We need about 4500 Euro to fund a bilingual version: If we recieve this amount of money we will translate

the original german book in a bilingual version (german / english), fund the printing costs and the new layout.If we do not get the hole costs supported, we will use the money for advertising the german version e.g on the Frankfurter Buchmesse in October 14.
if you have any questions, do
not hesitate to contact
us!

column6: >The orphanage of Goshen Kenya International Outreach began as a one-woman project to help the orphaned children of her home village of Kogelo, in Kenya, East Africa.
column11: >If seen from the air, Kogelo would seem only a line of small shops along a two-lane highway.  Dirt tracks cut through scrubland to family farms.  There is no electricity beyond the highway.  Water comes from wells or must be hand-carried in jugs from the river.
column13: >Alice Ngesa received the opportunity to live, work, and marry in the United States.
column15:
>Returning to Kogelo years later as Alice Ngesa Boston, American citizen, she saw the devastation of the HIV / AIDS epidemic. 

HIV/AIDS had killed a generation of parents, leaving many, many children orphaned. Some children found shelter with extended families -- grandparents, uncles, aunts, cousins. Others disappeared to the streets of towns and cities.

As most families in the villages of Kenya exist in poverty, without electricity, clean water, roads, or medical care, the expense of additional children imposed yet another hardship on the families. If the families provided shelter and food, the families often could not pay for education or even clothing. 

For the children orphaned in her village, Alice sent her own money to help families care for the orphans. She also found other sponsors to provide for children via MoneyGram. 

In 2007, Alice coordinated the shipment of a cargo container of clothing, books, toys, and school equipment to the village. ( Since then, she has tried to send a container every year. )

In 2008, she bought the property in the Kogelo countryside for the site of an orphanage.

Local people built the pre-school.  Alice hired and pays a teacher.

The photo montage at the start of the video shows the early years, as the orphanage progressed from a school and church under a mango tree, to a preschool built of traditional sticks and mud. Alice paid for the sheet-metal roofs of the mud-walled preschool and improvised kitchen.

She did this with her earnings and the volunteer work of the Kogelo community. Her money and containers of donated clothing, books, and toys  provided for approximately seventy children.  

Friends in Los Angeles saw she could not pay for the completion of an orphanage.  To raise funds to build a dormitory, kitchen, and classrooms, her friends guided her through the process of forming a 501 (c)(3), Goshen K. International Outreach, Inc.

In this Indiegogo.com campaign, she hopes to accelerate the completion of the orphanage.  In August, she will travel to Kenya again, at her own expense, to deliver another container of clothing, toys, and school supplies for the children.

$10,000 will provide for the building of a dormitory with solar night lights, a real kitchen, classrooms and a fence around the orphanage.  She will stay on site to supervise. 

The Christmas Day, 2013 section of the video shows the community welcoming Alice and her foreign friends.  A foreign volunteer videos and photographs the event.

A teacher from California interviews the pastor and Alice on the needs of the orphanage.

Photos and background information can be seen at -- 

http://www.goshenk.org/index.htm
column17:
>More videos can be seen at YouTube / Goshen Orphans --

http://www.youtube.com/channel/UCnGVs0l9XWU-5E2oQ03fing

In August, Alice hopes a volunteer will video the building of the facilities.  Contributors will be listed in the credits of the video.
column21: >All of the contributions will go to the orphanage.  Alice will not spend contributions on offices, hotels, or executives.  This is a project in progress for seven years.  Alice has financed what she could.  If Alice receives the full $10,000, she will devote all the funds to the buildings and fence.  If she receives less, she builds what she can.   If she receives more, she will build more and hire more teachers.
column23: >Please contribute.  Please forward this indiegogo.com project to everyone you know.  Please forward the videos or place the videos on your Facebook page.
column25: >In an era of impersonal and difficult-to-track multi-billion dollar foreign aid programs, this project will show where the donations go -- and the children who will sleep in their own beds and learn in their own classrooms.
column27: >Donations will give seventy orphans a future.
column29:
>They will thank you all their lives.

Support Sanchez Brown in fulfilling his dreams as he takes a huge step to relocate to L.A and study at one of the best drama schools in the World! 'STELLA ADLER'. You can do this by sponsoring him in a physically gruelling 13km Spartan Obstacle Race.
WHO AM I?

Hey guys, my name is Sanchez Brown. I am an actor who is passionate and in love with the craft. I have been described by many as the the next Tyler Perry due to the fact that not only do I act but I also write, direct and produce
column2: sharing similar qualities in the essence of my work ethic, graft and panache.

column1: I began acting from the age of 11, studying at Bodens drama school. Since then I have featured  in TV programmes on ITV and BBC which has given me the platform to build great relationships with industry professionals.

Now after many years of grinding and studying at part-time drama schools I have been presented with a wonderful opportunity to study at 'Stella Adler' in Los Angeles. I now finally believe all my hard-work and dedication is paying off. I have deferred my place until January to ensure that I raise enough money to pay for tuition.
Stella Adler School - An Inside Look

<div><b><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe class=""embedly-embed"" height=""326"" src=""https://cdn.embedly.com/widgets/media.html?src=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fembed%2FWOkwoIXyeFI%3Ffeature%3Doembed&amp

HOW MUCH DO I NEED TO RAISE?

GOAL: £5,000
My course in total cost £11,741.89. (first year) However i am currently working my butt off in two jobs to hopefully secure £7,000. With your help and my crazy hours at work we will make our target :)
Lets think of it like this if 500 of you donate £10 each our goal is achievable.
                                             *******************************
HOW CAN I HELP YOU?

How can I help Sanchez I hear you ask. Well there are many ways to support my journey to the L.A. The first is to sponsor me in this deadly and exhausting Spartan race. This race is not for the feint hearted and will take guts and determination to complete which are vital qualities needed to succeed within the acting industry.
<div>
RACE: The Spartan Race
DATE: Sunday 31st August, 2014
TIME: 11:00AM (come and support)
DISTANCE:It's a 13km+ obstacle race designed to challenge even the elite racer. Fastest times completed roughly 80 minutes. Longest times could be last up to 5 hours.

Short Summary

I am Dr. CK Quarterman and I am a graduate of Cathedral Bible College. I have known the president for twenty years as the college has taken shape. I am a pastor in Taylors, SC. I was horrified the other day to see that Dr. Wayne Miller had been arrested by Homeland Security and is being held on a 250,000 bond. I know murders who have had less bonds, not to mention he has a home and family in Marion and is by no means a flight risk!

It all started over several ""out of the country"" students mainly from old Communist countries claiming to Homeland Security that he was ""working them to hard"" and wasn't paying them enough. I doubt in their countries they could even make a daily wage. Homeland Security evidently has a ""tic"" about Christian Colleges. They have come down on him with both feet, all uncalled for in light of the fact that it is only a few complaining out of hundreds. 

This is a Christian College being Persecuted solely because of its hard work ethics and Christian standards.   

Help us raise money to get this Christian Bible College President out on bond and a lawyer to see that he isn't Persecuted any longer and that the College doesn't have to shut down!

Funding will go first toward bond then toward legal defense.

If we don't reach our goal all monies will be given to Cathedral Bible College and its Christian school, via Dr. Leslie Miller.

Please help stop the abuse of Homeland Security and it reaching even into our Christian schools!

I am helping all I can and pleading with other Americans to rally around this Persecuted Christian minister.

Hopefully we will be able to hire the best legal defense to champion the Christian cause and stop government abuse! 

Folks get the word out and make some noise about your campaign, before we lose all our rights to Homeland Security!

My name is Richard Dansereau. In October of 2012, at 42 years old, I decided to go back to school to pursue a BSN (Bachelor of Science in Nursing). I earned a BA in English in 1995 with the hopes of teaching. When that did not work out I bounced around from job to job never finding anything that challenged my mind while allowing me to give back to my community. When my younger sister suggested nursing, I had an ah-ha moment. I have been pursuing my BSN at South College since that time. I am slated to graduate in the fall of 2015 but I have encountered a major obstacle.

Next quarter, July to September 2014, I only need to take Pharmacotherapeutics for Nursing II. This course is only 4 hours which means that I will be part time and unfortunately financial aid is not available for part time students. I will be taking a full course load in the fall, September to December, so financial aid then will not be an issue. I have already applied for a Sallie Mae loan and a bank loan but was denied by both. I currently work full time for a dialysis clinic as a patient care technician (dialysis tech) to pay my living expenses and help maintain my nursing skills. I am an excellent student with a GPA in excess of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale.

This single class cost $3125 dollars. Funding for this class will allow me to continue my studies. When I finish with my BSN I will be able to contribute in a real and tangible way to the health of my community.

I do realize that not everyone has the financial ability to donate to help me become a nurse but if you want you can help in other ways. I would be very appreciative is you could share my need with your Facebook friends and/or Twitter followers. When I am a nurse I will be able to pay it forward in numerous ways, some of which have not occured to me.

Thanks for reading and thanks for helping.

Rich

On 25th April 2015, Nepal was struck by a devastating 7.8 magnitude earthquake that killed more than 8,600 people and destroyed 473,000 homes. The often neglected part of the tale is that over 14,000 children no longer have a school to go to...

Childreach International are working with the local government to build 100 new classrooms in the Sindhupalchowk district. The first few classrooms are beginning to go up as we speak, but there is still a long way to go...

<div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe class=""embedly-embed"" height=""326"" src=""https://cdn.embedly.com/widgets/media.html?src=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fembed%2FXMS46z4NdyM%3Ffeature%3Doembed&amp
column6:
schema=youtube"" width=""580"">
I am fundraising to join Childreach on one of their 'Big Builds' where volunteers help to make the new classrooms a stimulating and engaging learning environment. Having taken part in a Big Build Nepal in 2014, where I assisted with the construction of a brand new early childhood development centre, I am desperate to do all I can to ensure that children can access education in the aftermath of the earthquakes. (nb. the early development centre not only survived the earthquakes with zero damage, but it acted as a shelter to the community of Sankhu in the immediate aftermath of the disaster).
RAISED SO FAR ACROSS 2 PLATFORMS - £590

column1: I am grateful for whatever you can give. As a thank you, I'd like to offer the following perks.
£5 - A personal thank you on my 'lisaboylesmedia' social media platforms to share with your family and friends
£15 - A thank you letter personally written to you from the team at Childreach International
£50 - One of a kind handmade bracelet from Kathmandu
£100 - Sacred Nepali prayer flags from Kathmandu

column3: >All funds will be added to my cumulative
column4: > fundraising target of £2,300 on BT My Donate. From this page 100% of the money goes to Childreach International.

column1: Childreach know that every child has the right to live, learn and play. To be safe, healthy and free. In the aftermath of the earthquake, children's lives have turned upside down. Access to suitable classrooms, that will shelter them from the cold winter temperatures is a necessity in helping them to fulfil their potential.

Also, research indicates that children are at significantly less risk of falling into the preying hands of child traffickers if they are in school. Childreach, together with SOLD the Movie, are working to ensure that children are taught, not trafficked. New classrooms is but the tip of iceberg for their prevention work - but it needs to be the starting point as schools are the centre of a community.

The aftermath of monsoon season and the severe fuel crisis is slowing the progress on the new classrooms. Despite delays, Childreach are continuing to construct the new classrooms with the help of local experts and volunteers.

As a UK volunteer, there are often questions asked about 'voluntourism', and it is a valid concern. Childreach International understand this and ensures that no local jobs are affected by volunteers, the volunteers take on only unskilled labour and that the community is closely engaged in all decisions. Please read more here or don't hesitate to contact the programmes team at (+44)02031375500.

Please use the handy Indigogo sharing tools to post this campaign on your Facebook and Twitter pages. Why not take it a step further and email it out to our family, friends and colleagues. I really appreciate your support.

Childreach International are working with the local government to build 100 new classrooms in the Sindhupalchowk district. The first few classrooms are beginning to go up as we speak, but there is still a long way to go...

I am fundraising to join Childreach on one of their 'Big Builds' where volunteers help to make the new classrooms a stimulating and engaging learning environment. Having taken part in a Big Build Nepal in 2014, where I assisted with the construction of a brand new early childhood development centre, I am desperate to do all I can to ensure that children can access education in the aftermath of the earthquakes. (nb. the early development centre not only survived the earthquakes with zero damage, but it acted as a shelter to the community of Sankhu in the immediate aftermath of the disaster).RAISED SO FAR ACROSS 2 PLATFORMS - £590
I am grateful for whatever you can give. As a thank you, I'd like to offer the following perks.
£5 - A personal thank you on my 'lisaboylesmedia' social media platforms to share with your family and friends
£15 - A thank you letter personally written to you from the team at Childreach International
£50 - One of a kind handmade bracelet from Kathmandu
£100 - Sacred Nepali prayer flags from Kathmandu
All funds will be added to my cumulative fundraising target of £2,300 on BT My Donate. From this page 100% of the money goes to Childreach International.

Childreach know that every child has the right to live, learn and play. To be safe, healthy and free. In the aftermath of the earthquake, children's lives have turned upside down. Access to suitable classrooms, that will shelter them from the cold winter temperatures is a necessity in helping them to fulfil their potential.

Also, research indicates that children are at significantly less risk of falling into the preying hands of child traffickers if they are in school. Childreach, together with SOLD the Movie, are working to ensure that children are taught, not trafficked. New classrooms is but the tip of iceberg for their prevention work - but it needs to be the starting point as schools are the centre of a community.

The aftermath of monsoon season and the severe fuel crisis is slowing the progress on the new classrooms. Despite delays, Childreach are continuing to construct the new classrooms with the help of local experts and volunteers.

As a UK volunteer, there are often questions asked about 'voluntourism', and it is a valid concern. Childreach International understand this and ensures that no local jobs are affected by volunteers, the volunteers take on only unskilled labour and that the community is closely engaged in all decisions. Please read more here or don't hesitate to contact the programmes team at (+44)02031375500.

Please use the handy Indigogo sharing tools to post this campaign on your Facebook and Twitter pages. Why not take it a step further and email it out to our family, friends and colleagues. I really appreciate your support.",5.0,3,"2 Campaigns
|","Reading, United Kingdom",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/rebuild-nepal-keeping-children-in-school/pica

Darkzel Scholarship

Darkzel (Zachary) was an artist who worked for me over a number of years, providing art for Hentacle, Cthentacle, Blood! and a number of other projects as well as working with me on a comic project and discussing work on other, potential multimedia projects in the future.

Zel provided me with art, I got to see a young, talented and very promising artist grow in confidence, flexibility and skill. I got to help pay his way through his education and I got to become his friend in the process, as well as paying for some wonderful art along the way.

Zel was tragically killed while working as an English teacher in Korea, cutting short a life and a very promising career.

I've always enjoyed being able to help young artists with their careers by offering them work and after what happened with Zel I decided that the best thing to do in order to honour his memory and our friendship was to set up a scholarship fund for other, promising young artists.

Young fantasy, comic, anime and science fiction artists face an uphill struggle. The artistic establishment is often not equipped to understand and encourage them and art is often seen as a wasted education by parents and others. Art supplies are expensive and support can also be hard to find.

My intention is to help provide for these students, or other artists in need of help, and to create a self-perpetuating scholarship fund that builds over time.

Each year I invite donations to the fund. These donations go on top of the existing money raised over the past year from ongoing sales of Zel's art, and of sales of donated art to support the fundraising effort as well as art from those who win the scholarship each year. Over time this will create a collection of art by talented young artists and kind donors, providing them with exposure and money, and contributing to the fund for artists in the following years.

You can help by donating money here, donating art, and by spreading the word to budding young artists in school, college or university, or artists who are in need for other reasons - unemployment, disability, mental health etc.

at-risk students in the South Los Angeles area. Our programming will be interest-centered and project rich. <span style=""line-height: 1.45em

column3: crafts, games, caroms, ping-pong, basketball...you name it! The DEUP Learning Center After-School Program will be an exciting place to be in 2014. We will be ready to love, respect and provide services that enrich the lives of our children. We will operate Mon-Fri, for the entire school year. Mission Statement: The DEUP Learning Center is being established to provide zero cost after-school and summer programming to under-resourced, at-risk youth throughout South Los Angeles. Our mission is to create project driven after-school learning environments that inspire and foster healthy thinking and living in ways that equip youth to confidently confront the issues of poverty and disadvantage.

column3: >This is indeed a very ambitious project, but this is exactly why we’re here. We need your help. If we are unable to answer this call, and open these doors… right here in South Los Angeles, it just means that we have to stand on the sidelines…again to watch yet another generation of inner-city youth withdraw and retreat back into the clutch of poverty and disadvantage. The youth of South Los Angeles deserve so much more than this. They deserve great teachers and they deserve great programs.  We believe that the children of South Los Angeles have a natural right to exercise their minds in ways that promote positive change for their communities.  DEUP is determined and willing to stand up for the cause of change in the inner-city and offer a creative and healthy after-school setting, where the emotional and educational well being of South L.A.’s children is always top priority.

column1: Come August of 2014, these doors will swing wide open…and we will embrace, support and befriend the community with all our heart.  We ask that you stand with us to make a difference.
DEUP Learning Center…We are transforming the environment with love and some good honest, interest-centered education. Keep reading to find out how the funds will be used.
What will the funds be used for?
