Fascinating information about men's stages of development.  Predictable and unavoidable, these stages determine what men live for and what they can't live without.  Understanding the differences between the stages of a man's life are critical for success in romantic relationships, raising sons, and working effectively with men.

Alison Unplugged ... Intimate Weekend with Alison and 9 Special Women in Colorado!
For our top tier donors - an exclusive women's weekend at my home in Colorado on October 19 &
This is an intimate, custom weekend for Extraordinary Women looking for Extraordinary Conversations - where nothing is off limits!  Exclusive to our top contributors and not available for sale.
I will design our conversations from your answers to the question: ""If you could have me talk about anything, what would it be?""
Details:
- Limited to only 9 special women
- October 19-20, 2013
- Saturday 10-9pm, including dinner together, and Sunday 10-6pm (Please plan to travel by air Friday and Monday)
- At my home in rural, western Colorado, 85 miles from Grand Junction. Transportation and lodging not included.
If you are traveling by Air, we recommend:
- Flying into Grand Junction, Colorado
- Staying in Paonia on Friday and Saturday night.  My house is 22 miles from Paonia.  We will provide a list of recommended hotels in Paonia.
- Staying at a hotel in Grand Junction Colorado on Sunday night for early Monday flights out.
We will set up a closed Facebook group so you can coordinate with each other if you would like.
Your generous donation does include lunch and dinner on Saturday and lunch on Sunday.

It's time again for the 6th annual Five-College Queer Gender and Sexuality Conference will take place on March 6th and 7th at Hampshire College! For years, t
column5: >his conference has offered an accountable and supportive environment in which to
column9: >further explore a wide range of topics and their intersections, such as race, genders,
column13: >sexualities, ability, class, kink, survival strategies, and many more, in a specifically
column17:
>queer context.

We strive to provide a safer space for engaging, learning, and fostering community with a wide range of workshops, panels, performances, and lectures by student leaders, Five-College faculty and staff, and off-campus educators. This open and inclusive conference is FREE and organized by a dedicated volunteer committee comprised of students from the Five Colleges and a staff advisor.

We strongly believe in the importance of free, accessible educational events. As such, we do not charge a registration fee to attend our conference. In years past we have raised all of the budget through internal donations, but this year we are concerned that might not be sufficient to pull off the kind of fabulous event we have planned.

This is where you come in!!! We are asking you - if you can - to donate any of the amounts listed here. Every dollar counts!

How can you support us?

This conference is planned and executed by a team of students from Hampshire and UMass Amherst
column21:
>. The total cost for this student inspired, led, and organized two-day event will be $16,000, which is DOUBLE the budget we've had in the past.

Our conference is two days packed with workshops, panels, educational forums, and all kinds of fun and exciting exploratory activities! We also bring in excellent speakers and artistic performance groups for our opening and closing ceremonies! Your contribution will make this event an amazing success, something that you will be proud to support!

For helping us out, you will receive anything from personal thank you's on our Facebook page and in our program, to hip Queer Conference swag, hand made patches, or a personalized poster of our appreciation to be displayed throughout the conference and given to you.

Why is this event important?

This conference fills an unmet need for a designated space to teach, learn, and explore matters relating to queer identities and their intersections. We address topics touched on in queer studies classrooms as well as in our personal and professional lives. This is a great opportunity for networking, sustainable community building, and strategizing for social change.

Equally as important, it is an opportunity for personal discovery and growth. Students and community members can gain leadership skills through facilitating workshops and panels. All attendees are invited to spend the day learning, sharing, and making connections.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute monetarily. You can help us in other ways! Spread the word, and spread these links!!!

Visit our webpage

Like us on Facebook

Register now

And share this campaign!

For any other comments, questions, or concerns, please feel free to e-mail us at erimmer@hampshire.edu

Short Summary

Hello, we are the Evergreen 6 Solar Boat Team and we are entering the Northern California Solar Boat Regatta. Evergreen 6 is a sixth grade public school program within Paradise Intermediate School in Butte County. Our team is made up of middle school students. The team meets after school on a volunteer basis with help from an all-volunteer group of parents, community members and staff. Together the team fundraises, designs, builds and plans for the race day. This is a great example of STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Math) activities.

This will be our fourth year competing and we would like to make a few more changes this year. Our first year, we didn't do as well as we had planned and we ended up not winning anything, but we did have an amazing experience. We decided to try again in 2013 and ended up winning two trophies
column2: Best Spirit and Best Middle School. Last year in 2014 we did great
column3: we got 2nd, 3rd, and 4th place in our races and also won two trophies (Best Middle School and Best Video.) This year were going for the gold!

column1: Our last boat was great… which was from Old Town Canoe who heard about our team, and donated a brand new boat! (Thanks Old Town!) But again…our boat needs a diet. All donations we receive will go to buying a new motor, battery, and the expenses of traveling to the actual event.
<ul>
• Our goal is $1200 which will all go to buying electronics and improving our boat.
• We will use the donations to buy things like a new motor and our team t-shirts.
• The donations we receive to buy new bits and pieces for our new boat will greatly increase our chances to have a better boat and our chances to win the Regatta Cup!

The Evergreen 6 Solar Boat team appreciates you checking out our awesome video, story, and amazing perks. Please help us reach our goal of winning the gold!!

Situation

column4: > Some tents and food are needed at faraway Namtar and Agra villages in Makawan district. 154 and around 250 people have no shelter there, the Namtar village have now food for 20 days, 1 tent and collecting more, a day after tomorrow we think we can provide through Manab Seva Ashram (7-8 teams collecting) enough for Namtar for tomorrow. column5: >My name is Carol Farneti Foster and I have both a Biology and Medical Technology degree with 30 years experience making documentary films.  I am very passionate about not only helping the environment but also humans with disabilities. I have a disability myself and know the struggles.  I really want to help the blind people in Belize to learn and practice a unique scientifically known method called ""Flash Sonar"" or echolocation, so they can see the world through sound.  Here in Belize the blind struggle everyday to become independent and many are isolated because they lack specialized training. There are no schools for the blind and limited programs for them in the country.   There is only one non-profit organization called the Belize Council for the Visually Impaired(BCVI) that has a rehabilitation program and a camp every summer. They are doing an excellent job with the limited resources but can not continue with the necessary training. So I found a remarkable way to help the situation to give the blind an opportunity to have their freedom by learning how to see through sonar.
column7:
/>

While researching a documentary on bat echolocation I came across a remarkable blind person who has discovered, unknowingly at a very early age, human echolocation, and was able to find his way in the world. His name is Daniel Kish who lost his eyes at the age of 13months as a result of cancer,called retinoblastoma.  His parents always treated him like a normal child.  By the age of 15months he started 'Seeing' by making tongue clicks which echo back from objects enabling him to build a mental picture of his surroundings. Daniel is very targeted and determined. He went to normal schools and was able to ride a bike, explore parks, climb trees and cross roads with little to no help.  Eventually he obtained his own apartment and went to university where he received master degrees in developmental psychology and special education and then became the first totally blind person to be legally a Certified Orientation and Mobility Specialist  and to hold a National Blindness Professional Certification.                                                                                                                                       

Prominent neurologists wanting to study Daniels discovery placed him in a 3D MRI machine and recorded the echoes made from the clicks and it showed that the visual cortex part of the brain lights up making a connection with the audio cortex to allow him to form an image of the surroundings.  Daniel has proven humans that are blind, can echo locate, like bats, and called it Flash Sonar.  Once Daniel understood what was happening in his brain he knew positivity, without a doubt, that all blind people have the capability . Flash sonar is not really hearing from a neurological perspective
column8:
it is a peculiar sense all its own, trainable, surprisingly acute in experts, and capable of facilitating skilled echo locators to do many tasks that they couldn't do without the sense. Daniel trained other blind people to master Flash Sonar and in the year 2000 he stared a non-profit organization called World Access for the Blind in the USA, which to this day has taught more than 10,000 blind people in nearly 40 different countries how to see through sound. The ability of individuals vary and it requires dedication and perseverance, but the rewards are remarkable.

                        

                                     

The program would involve a trained instructor from the World Access for the Blind to teach three determined and committed subjects chosen by The Belize Council for the Visually Impaired in Belize.  Daniel says it is mandatory that their families and people from BCVI be with them so they will see how these methods work and help with follow up activities. There will be fourteen people altogether for an 8 day course.  In turn the three subjects once they mastered the Flash Sonar Technique will teach other blind people in Belize.

                                     

In order to finance this project I have to raise $16,100US dollars. This will pay fees to Instructor from Daniels non-profit organization and all other costs over the period of 8 days. It will cover fourteen people for travel, food,  accommodation, insurance and entrance fees to parks. The course is designed to not only learn Flash Sonar but push the subjects outside their normal range of activity during which they begin to learn and identify new objects and environments. They will walk the busy streets of Belize City and visit new places and events like a marine parade, a large supermarket, a museum and also go to the airport. They will go on expeditions outside of Belize City to caves to hear bats also echo locating using flash sonar to tell the difference between surface textures. They will walk in a forest and learn the sonic echoes of trees and or whatever else they find. They will go to the local vegetable market in Belmopan and swim in the river nearby at a national park. Afterwards there will be a follow up and support from the teacher, Daniel or colleague, for both students and their families.

column1: My husband and I will make a documentary video of the project, free of charge, which will be given to all families, people involved in the program and also to some contributors.
The BCVI can not donate funds but they can help with obtaining better rates locally providing conference space and free airfare for the instructor coming from California to Belize.
Thank you so much and hope you can give something to help with this incredible program.

Please see video which I put together from a conglomeration of differ productions done on Daniel Kish and other blind people.  Much of the material was obtained from the World Access of the Blind and on Youtube. The material we shot was an interview with me and Rowan Garel. Rowan is one of the three subjects in this program and he really wants to learn and master Flash Sonar to teach others.
For Further Information see the video in the campaign funding program and please check the following websites and  also YouTube.
Websites- World Access for the Blind--- www.worldaccessfortheblind.org
column5: >                   Belize Council for the Visually Impaired---www.bcvi.org

column1: ","My name is Carol Farneti Foster and I have both a Biology and Medical Technology degree with 30 years experience making documentary films.  I am very passionate about not only helping the environment but also humans with disabilities. I have a disability myself and know the struggles.  I really want to help the blind people in Belize to learn and practice a unique scientifically known method called ""Flash Sonar"" or echolocation, so they can see the world through sound.  Here in Belize the blind struggle everyday to become independent and many are isolated because they lack specialized training. There are no schools for the blind and limited programs for them in the country.   There is only one non-profit organization called the Belize Council for the Visually Impaired(BCVI) that has a rehabilitation program and a camp every summer. They are doing an excellent job with the limited resources but can not continue with the necessary training. So I found a remarkable way to help the situation to give the blind an opportunity to have their freedom by learning how to see through sonar.                   While researching a documentary on bat echolocation I came across a remarkable blind person who has discovered, unknowingly at a very early age, human echolocation, and was able to find his way in the world. His name is Daniel Kish who lost his eyes at the age of 13months as a result of cancer,called retinoblastoma.  His parents always treated him like a normal child.  By the age of 15months he started 'Seeing' by making tongue clicks which echo back from objects enabling him to build a mental picture of his surroundings. Daniel is very targeted and determined. He went to normal schools and was able to ride a bike, explore parks, climb trees and cross roads with little to no help.  Eventually he obtained his own apartment and went to university where he received master degrees in developmental psychology and special education and then became the first totally blind person to be legally a Certified Orientation and Mobility Specialist  and to hold a National Blindness Professional Certification.                                                                                                                                        Prominent neurologists wanting to study Daniels discovery placed him in a 3D MRI machine and recorded the echoes made from the clicks and it showed that the visual cortex part of the brain lights up making a connection with the audio cortex to allow him to form an image of the surroundings.  Daniel has proven humans that are blind, can echo locate, like bats, and called it Flash Sonar.  Once Daniel understood what was happening in his brain he knew positivity, without a doubt, that all blind people have the capability . Flash sonar is not really hearing from a neurological perspective

Briefly, I

want to bring you up to date on what’s happening in my life: I am currently working at one of the world’s largest international publishing houses, Reed Elsevier. Shortly, I will be leaving Elsevier and working as a satellite
employee for a privately contracted publishing group called Graphic World. As a
satellite employee, I am uniquely positioned with the opportunity to work off
my laptop, potentially from anywhere within the U.S. As this is the case, I am
able to make a previously unlikely goal come to fruition-- attending Ecclesia.
Ecclesia
is a formation program led by the religious brothers and sisters of the
Community of St. John at the University of Mary in Bismarck, North Dakota. This
month-long program is centered on study of philosophy, theology and spiritual
formation. The opportunity to earn undergraduate, graduate or continuing
education credits is offered, all while experiencing a summer of prayer, study and
fellowship with other young people from across the country. As a part of this
group, I will have the opportunity to be formed at Ecclesia with what is best
and most authentic in our Catholic Tradition: the life of the Church herself.
Even
now, after graduating from USD, I still consider myself a student. As such, I
want to continue my learning in a way that it will benefit me personally, as
well as preparing me to give back to the greater Catholic community that I am

involved in, as a leader and role model.

What is Needed:
column4: >Simply broken down, I will need help in raising the following:
column13:
>Fee Expense: 200.00

Total: approx. 3300.00

I will personally be contributing upwards of 500.00 on top of my goal, and possibly more if I am unable to meet my goal. I sincerely thank everyone who is willing to help in contributing.
column16:
>Before I even started this funding, I've received an incredible amount of verbal support and potential for help. In the event that I exceed my goal, funds will be used to help other students in the program in need of financial assistance.


The Impact:

Currently, my short term goal in attending Ecclesia is to prepare myself to give back to the church in a more invested manner. That being, to be a teacher or youth leader at my local parish. Personally, I would love to get involved in the confirmation program as a teacher. My long term goals include moving forward with my education, and ultimately teaching at the collegiate level. Once fulfilled, I wish to become involved in the Catholic ministry at whichever university I have the honor be teaching at, and act as a youth adviser, or leader among students.

Ecclesia would be an incredible opportunity for me because I've been desiring to grow in my faith and my spiritual development. I want to be a resource for anyone who may be questioning or simply have questions about faith, and right now I know I could use some intensive preparation. In attending Ecclesia I hope to learn more fully about the history and tradition of the church, all while forming long term habits that I may institute into my everyday life. Ecclesia will allow me to do ths because, again, at my core, I am a student, and developing myself spiritually, through intensive study and prayer, is most wholly suited for me. 

Other Ways You Can Help:

Some people just can’t contribute, and I completely understand, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help. I would ask that you please share my fundraising campaign and simply get the word out that you have a brother in need of help from his community.

For more Information:

GotoEcclesia.com

<strong>
<b><strong>Inspired by the strong alumni donor systems built into most Academic
institutions in the US, we would like to set in place a
private, transparent, international online donation campaign to support
exceptional students with financial needs from St Sava, the oldest and very prestigious high
school in Bucharest, Romania. Fellowships will help defray initial college
costs for the selected students. Importantly, this campaign is aimed to set a
precedent for the Romanian education system, as our goal is to build trust in the power of private donations.
<h3><b>Who
We Are
We represent a group of alumni of

the St Sava high school (Colegiul National Sf Sava). St Sava high school is the oldest and one of the most prestigious high schools in Bucharest, Romania, established in year 1688. We - the alumni - have various professions (professors, programmers, businessmen or women, etc.), and now live in various parts of the world, in Romania, Europe, US, Australia. We have recently reconnected, as we are celebrating our respective 15th and 20th St Sava high school reunions, and would like to set an important precedent by starting this ""American style"" fundraising campaign for our high school.

We would like to invite our Romanian and international friends to become part of this exciting campaign. We are grateful for any help we can get in our quest, as your donations of any size will make a very big difference for our worthy cause.
What We Need &
We aim to raise at least $2000, and hopefully much more! Our
fundraising effort is dedicated to providing fellowships to exceptional
12th grade - graduating students - of St Sava high school who are financially in need. Each fellowship (a
$1000 minimum) is meant to help the student defray some of the initial costs

(books, transportation, student fees) of college. The students will be chosen via a competition open to all, advertised in the spring semester 2015 in the St Sava high school. We are looking for all-around exceptional students with good grades and impressive CVs. Some of our donors (see ""Perks"") and campaign volunteers will be invited to choose the students in a fully transparent fashion. Any student can submit a CV and a Personal Statement
are reviewed by the campaign volunteers and donors with voting power
students split the total funds in equal parts.
We will provide a few unique perks for our donors (See the Perks section for details), depending on the donation level. Our donors will be
acknowledged in the fellowship letters to our chosen students, will receive updates on the selection of students and can participate actively in the selection of student fellows.
The Impact
In a country in which the average salary per
economy is below $500/month, and some people are paid $200/month, your donation can have a sizable economic impact for graduating high school students coming from less privileged backgrounds.
Importantly, your donation will also be
a first step towards building and connecting a community that cares about
improving education and opportunities for young high school graduates in Romania, and an active alumni community for the oldest Bucharest high school.
Those of us who have spent time in Universities
or businesses outside Romania, and particularly in the US, have understood the
critical importance that a strong Alumni group and private donations can have
in supporting educational institutions and endeavors, and students with financial need. We would like to set
in place for the first time such a private, fully transparent, donation campaign, and by doing so
set an important precedent in the Romanian education system. Indiegogo is
the perfect conduit for such an open, transparent experiment.
If successful, we plan to broaden our fundraising efforts in future
years in order to establish continuity for these student fellowships,
and have a longer-term impact.
Other Ways You Can Help
Spread the word ! We
want to get people talking and as excited as we are about our project! You can use the
Indiegogo share tools for this.
Additionally, we are
asking St Sava alumni and friends to support our project by dedicating their time and
energy to help present and future fundraising efforts for our former
high-school. Please contact irinamarinov@gmail.com for further information on
volunteering or helping our ""St Sava high school"" campaign in other ways.

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><h2 style=""text-align: center
<span style=""font-weight: normal
column4: >"" if Carolyn hears about this someone is getting

column2: >20 days left until Christmas and the campaign only got its final spit and polish today! Time is of the essence!
column3:
>P.S. We're not joking. Carolyn can't know.
**UPDATE** Thank you to everyone who donated! Calo received her gift on boxing day, Martha and Emma had a nice visit with her and gave Calo her present and she was overwhelmed by everyone's kindness and generosity.
A big thank you to everyone who donated on IndieGoGo or sent Martha a cheque in the mail. Carolyn is delighted and very excited to go to the Kripalu Centre. More details on what that is to come! Calo will be sending everyone a thank you note when her plans are firmed up.

--- The Secret Short Story ---


- Who?

A Super Secret Fundraising Campaign for Carolyn's Singing Adventure, organized by her dear friend Martha Campbell and Emma Mackenzie Hillier (Calo's daughter).


- What?

We're raising money so that Carolyn can take that much needed ""time off"" that she always talks about but remains elusive. We want to send her to the Kripalu Centre, in which she has expressed interest several times, for a singing retreat (or yoga, or kayaking, or creative expression, the list of options is numerous).

She will also receive a little book with any kind words of love or affection that you want to pass onto her. More on how that works below


- Where?

The Kripalu Centre in Stockbridge, Massachusetts.


- When?

The gift is to be given this Christmas day (our campaign ends on Christmas Eve).

The gift is intended to be flexible to her choice of retreat. She mentioned a singing seminar, of which there is one in March from the 27th to the 29th. I've sneakily had her book off that weekend under the guise of our taking a trip somewhere. But she may choose another seminar or retreat to attend.


- How?

On Christmas morning Carolyn will receive a little booklet with all of your messages and a list of everyone who was able to donate. She will also receive a small envelope with everyone's conrtributions inside.

Martha and Emma both want to say that no amount is too small or too large. There aren't any ""perks"" on this campaign because it's really just about being part of Calo's community.

You can donate online by clicking the button at the top of the page. IndieGoGo is a fantastic crowd-funding campaign that is completely safe and secure for your use. I will email you and ask you if you'd like to include a message to her that will be included in the little booklet (choose your font! choose the size! or leave it up to me!)

OR you can donate by mailing a cheque (made out to Carolyn Mackenzie) with your handwritten message to this address:

Martha Campbell

P.O. Box 135,

613 Penner St.

Virgil, Ont.

L0S 1TO

Martha lives quite close to us and she and I will arrange a clandestine meeting in the few days before Christmas so that I can put all your lovely messages into the book and put all the donations into an envelope.


- Why?

Because Carolyn is one of the most selfless and kind people I know, but she so often gives up all her time and energy to others that she doesn't save some for herself. I know it would mean a lot to her to receive a big dollop of extra love and care this Christmas.

We'll let you know how it all turns out with maybe a picture or two...


--- The Still Secret Long Story ---

- The Backstory -

Carolyn is one of the loveliest people I know, full of grace, smiles, and a sweet temper, she has always been a symbol to me of what it means to be a truly kind, loving, and good person. Whether it's her family, the casts in her shows, or her students, she is exceptional at putting others first. Often this means that she puts herself last on her priorities list. Martha and I say: Christmas 2014 will end this!

Martha Campbell, with whom Calo shares a long relationship dating back to her Stage Management days at the Shaw, approached me a few days ago with a great idea to help Calo put Calo first, and to invite all of her friends and family to do that too. Calo has mentioned to both Martha and I how much she wants to go to the Kripalu Centre in Stockbridge, Massachusetts. She told Martha that she'd love to go for a singing seminar, Calo told me that she'd love to go for yoga. It turns out, at the Kripalu Centre there are tons of retreats and options for that much needed break that Carolyn keeps mentioning but never getting. For a list of all their various Program Themes, check out www.kripalu.org

Martha and I would like to invite you to help us give Calo a vacation, and to also put your personal touch on it, should you want (more on that below!). This gesture would mean a lot to her, if only just so she's reminded that there is a large group of people who think about her with great affection and wanted to help her do something nice for herself.

- The Goal and The Details -

- How the money will be used and gathered: The goal is to raise enough money to cover the cost of tuition, her stay at the centre, and travel (enough for gas, or at least enough to make a dent in a plane ticket). The entire cost of the trip shouldn't be more than $1,500 (tuition, room and board, travel), which is by no means terrifically expensive but is really made possible when friends and family come together.

There is a singing retreat in March that seems right up Calo's alley. I've already sneakily asked her to book that weekend off so that she and I can ""go away somewhere."" That way if she decides to go to sing, she's all set to go. If she decides to go for yoga, she can choose a time when she's not teaching and pressed to get back.

Online: at this IndieGoGo campaign (just hit the ""Fund"" button near the top). To be transparent, the money will be deposited into a special account for Carolyn and I'll include a note about the final amount with all the other donations on Christmas morning.

OR Cheque: Write your cheque out to Carolyn Mackenzie, include your personalized note, and mail to this address:

Martha Campbell

P.O. Box 135,

613 Penner St.

Virgil, Ont.

L0S 1TO

Martha and I will arrange a clandestine meeting in the few days before Christmas so that I can put all your lovely messages into the book and put all the donations into an envelope.

- What makes this extra special: We'd like to give her a card on Christmas morning with all the details about her present along with a little book with your messages of love and care in them. After you donate online, I'll contact you for your message and include it in the book. If you've sent in a handwritten note, I'll collect it from Martha and include it that way.

If you don't want to send a message or remain anonymous, that's fine! But we'd love to include a lovely page with all the names of the loved ones who donate. 

We're also going to send everyone who donates a little note about how the present is received and what she decides to wind up doing at the Kripalu Centre this coming year!

So that's the story, folks! We hope that you'll join us in helping give Carolyn a pretty spectacular Christmas present this year and a pretty fantastic experience to boot.

","- By ""Super Secret"" we mean ""Top Secret"" if Carolyn hears about this someone is getting coal for Christmas"" -

Hi! Thanks for visiting this site. 

My name is Meredith Hopping and I have been given an incredible opportunity to travel to Haiti as part of the Haiti Clean Water Project. 

About the Haiti Clean Water Project

Haiti became big news in January of 2010, after a 7.0 magnitude earthquake rocked Haiti's capitol city Port-au-Prince. Not long after that, the cholera epidemic began. People were left without homes and began to band together in tent cities, which quickly became breeding grounds for sickness, including cholera.

Cholera is caused by the bacteria Vibrio cholerae, and is a bacterial infection of the intestine, which causes the telltale symptoms of digestive upset. While an estimated 80% of cases are easily treatable with only clean water and electrolytes, the disease can also be fatal within as little as a few hours if untreated. Fortunately, cholera is as preventable as it is deadly
column2:
a reliable source of clean water is all it takes to break the cycle of cholera in a community.

The Sawyer PointONE water filter combines simple use and maintenance with cutting edge technology that can provide over one million gallons of clean water for only $60. Installation takes only a few minutes but the filters can provide clean water for more than 10 years. The filters function similarly to kidney dialysis machines, except far more effectively. The PointONE filter uses thousands of hollow tubes with pores .0000001 meters wide to trap harmful parasites and bacteria from passing through into the water, which can then be used for drinking, cooking, cleaning, and bathing safely. 


The amazing thing about this opportunity coming to me at this time is that last year when I turned 30, I made a list of 30 things I wanted to do before I turned 31. Leaving the country was on said list, but I had resigned to this not happening this year. 


I turn 31 on December 27th, and will leave for Haiti on December 28th. 


Sometimes God's timing is even more hilarious and perfect than anything we could ever imagine or dream. In my mind, if I did make it out of the country, it would be a jaunt to Mexico, or Canada. . .going to Haiti to work with a Mission and Ministry that is so amazing is a privilege and honor. 


Because of the short timeframe we are dealing with, I am asking for financial assistance in getting me there! Think about it, pray about it, and if it is something you feel compelled to support, I would be extremely grateful!

Thank you. Thank you. Thank you.  M'goi. Dawjeh. Shei Shei. Danke. Merci. Grazie. Gracias.   Together we have reached our USD5,000 immediate goal.  But we still need approximately USD40,000 more to get Uday into the sky in two years time.  Please help us keep up the momentum and share the good news with your circle of friends and family.  Today is Uday's birthday.  He will be thrilled with this gift.
PLEASE HELP CREATE A LITTLE MAGIC
FOR A VERY SPECIAL BOY IN INDIA
<div>

How does magic work? Not the magic of deception and misdirection but the magic of the heart. How does magic bring joy to the hearts of both the giver and receiver of a gift? When we give something, be it, money, love, time, peace or joy, we realise that we already had it and when we give it away, it purifies and frees the mind. The receiver of the gift benefits and we lose the boundary between “them” and “us” and our shared reality becomes stronger. The love for humanity grows and fear weakens. Give instead of take. Offer instead of expect. These truths create the magic that can save our world.
Would you like to help me bring the gift of magic to a very special boy in India?

Uday is 17 years old. When he was young he lived in the mountains of Mussoorie in a tiny shoebox of a concrete room with barely any light. His father carried stones or people on his back for a living. Any kind of future was bleak yet Uday was a happy and smiling young boy with giant eyes and joyful giggle. His family sent him to an NGO hostel in Rishikesh where he could get food, education, medical care and the attention he craved.

I have known Uday for almost 10 years now. Not once have I seen him angry. He takes his studies seriously and is always in the 90s coming first or second in his class. Just recently he completed 10th class with 100%. He is a star amongst stars, helping others with their chores, never complaining. He is a superb cricket player, a natural leader who effortlessly receives great respect from his peers, younger children and adults alike. His natural wisdom, happiness and generosity denote his spiritual nature and the kindness and sensitivity he shows to his girlfriend make him a wonderful role model.

I have been sponsoring Uday for his education the last two years and now as he is entering 11th class, with just two years of studies to go, his childhood dream of becoming a commercial pilot is still strong. As pilot training is extremely expensive Uday has been told by many people for a long time to forget his dream. I am hoping, that with a little magic, we can help his dream come true. If any young man has it in him to make a positive change in our troubled world, it is Uday. When I told him it would cost USD58,000 for the full training, his eyes and face dropped
column2: a dream crashed. From his background, USD1,000 is way out of touch, forget USD58,000. When I told him that I would try my best to help and that he was worth it, his eyes and face began to shine with humble radiance.

column3:
/>

So this appeal to you is part of my promise to a very special teenager. Would you like to help create some magic? Would you like to feel the joy in giving and contribute to a dream? I cannot do this without you. I offer my sincere gratitude and appreciation to you, just for listening.

column1: <div>

The full cost for commercial pilot training is USD58,000.  A little money has already been raised and we are desperately searching everywhere and anywhere for help.  In this Indiegogo campaign, we are seeking to raise USD5,000.  This money will go straight into a fixed deposit which receives 9% interest for the next 2 years while Uday finishes school.  Thus your contribution will be even higher in due course.  USD5,000 is enough to cover approximately 80 of the 200 hours of practice flying time required to obtain a commercial license.  If this campaign is not successful, any funds raised will still go towards Uday's pilot training, as our team is determined to make Uday's dream come true.
If you cannot help financially, please please forward this campaign to your friends and family.  Uday is worth it.  And the magic you create will ripple back to you.
For more information about Uday's story and the Yogi Yum Yums education fund, please visit http://www.yogiyumyums.com

Our Goal

In anticipation of this campaign, we have begun fundraising among our family and friends and have already raised $1,450.00!  Our original goal was $8000, but in light of people's amazing generosity and excitement about the Rhythm Board, we've lowered our goal to $6,550.00.  Thank you to everyone who has contributed already, and thank you in advance for supporting this project!
<div>
What's a Rhythm Board?
<div>

The Rhythm Board is a tactile, puzzle-like tool designed to teach rhythm in an intuitive way.  The board and pieces are all made out of wood and are sized relative to the length of the note.  For example,  a quarter note is 1/2 the size of a half note, and 1/4 the size of a whole note.  The board itself has four 1-beat spaces on the top, and two 4-beat spaces underneath.  This way a student can begin with understanding how a single beat is made up and then how those beats are combined and relate to one another.  There are four full beats of each note, and each piece has the note on one side and its equivalent rest on the other, with bright colors to make the distinction clear for the student.  Because the design is simple, students easily grasp the function of each rhythm and the relationship of one rhythm to the next.

The Look  - The pictures here are of the most recent prototype, but look slightly different from the final product.  Because we have decided to go with laser cutting for precision, the edges of the board, spaces, and pieces will be black from where the laser burns the wood. It will not be available any other way, as cutting it with the laser is the best way to ensure that all the pieces fit easily and reliably.  Here's a sample of what the edges will look like
column2: I can't wait to see how the clean black edges look on the board itself!

column1: Who is it for?
The Rhythm Board is for anyone teaching or learning music that would like to have more fun and more success understanding rhythm.
<div><ul>
<li>
General Music Teachers - instead of trying to write everything on a chalk board, the Rhythm Board can be held up and shown to the class at large, or given to individuals or small groups to work with.
<li>
Private Lesson Instructors - work one-on-one with students to teach a variety of both simple and complex concepts.
<li>
Montessori Classrooms - keep available for students to play with individually or teach other children what they've learned.
<li>
Parents - have at home as an introduction to music and rhythm for their children.
<li>
Students - use this during practicing to figure out rhythms in their music or to write their own music.
<h3>Short Summary - <span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column2: >How the Rhythm Board Came to Be

column1: As a violin teacher, I am always looking for the most natural and intuitive ways to help my students learn new skills and concepts.  As other teachers will relate to, whether working with very young students, middle and high schoolers or adults, there seems to be a broad sense of confusion about rhythm. This got me wondering if there was some deficiency in how rhythm was being taught.  Looking around,  the only rhythm teaching aids widely available were flash cards and black boards - tools that only encourage repetition.  Students needed an engaging medium that would convey the relationship of each rhythmic value to a beat and show how those values relate to one another and can be combined.

After visiting a Montessori classroom, I was inspired by their self-correcting teaching tools, and sat down to make my own tool I called the Rhythm Box.  I took it to my students and to the Montessori classroom and was blown away by how quickly students were catching on and how much they were able to figure out without any help!  Immediately my little box caught the attention of my students' parents and other teachers and they encouraged me to produce and patent it.

It's been almost a year since then, and my original rhythm box has become the Rhythm Board, and it is officially ""patent pending"" as of December 31!  My husband and I have funded all of the legal work and production so far, but to get the first run of products made I need your help!  

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

 Playing with the Rhythm Board guides students to the vital understanding of how each rhythm relates to the next and how they all relate to a musical beat.  My goal is to make the success I've seen with my students available to every music educator, parent, student, and novice.

column1: I already have orders coming in for the Rhythm Board, but at this point, I have no products to sell. This is where you come in! Your financial contributions will pay for the Rhythm Board's first production run which will fill these initial orders in addition to creating a supply that will be sold through this campaign and commercially.
column2: > You will also help fund initial marketing and PR and advance future
column4: > for the Rhythm Board.   I am already working with local music, educational, and toy stores to build a local awareness, but your help will allow me to get the Rhythm Board into the hands of larger, music-specific retailers who could introduce it to a much wider audience.

column1: If we make our full goal, then I'll also be able to pursue other variations of the Rhythm Board.
column2: > The first would be a Rhythm Board specifically designed for Montessori classrooms - one that is more natural looking and includes a wooden tray so students can easily transport the board to and from their work stations.  I've also been approached about making a Rhythm Board app, which could really broaden the exposure of this tool.

column1: What you get with your investment (Perks)
There are several ways you can support us:
$10 - THANK YOU!
$25 - Key Chain
INTRODUCTORY PRICE - Take advantage of a one-time introductory price and simply purchase your very own Rhythm Board!
$50  - Rhythm Board
$75 - Rhythm Board + Key Chain

SUSTAINING CONTRIBUTION - Choose to give a donation that will meaningfully drive the Rhythm Board's success by choosing a specific facet of its development to support. As a token of our thanks, you will receive a Rhythm Board and a key chain for your contribution.
$100 - Promoting to larger companies
$150 - Future product development
$200 - Current Product Production
$250 Video Production
$300 Business Affiliate
Anyone who receives a Rhythm Board will also receive a link to several teaching videos on how to teach various rhythm lessons using the Rhythm Board.  Lessons include:
<ul>
• Rhythm Syllables - How I use the board and rhythmic syllables when working with my students
• Understanding Dotted Rhythms - Explaining how to count a dotted note
• Understanding Note Names - Explaining why a quarter note called a quarter note
• Combining Sixteenth Notes and Eighth Notes - Making subdivisions clear
• Beginning Composition - Writing a song by ear onto paper
• Playing Rhythms - Showing how a student works through a rhythm to be able to play it confidently on her instrument
Risks &
<div>
<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column2: >Fit - One of the biggest challenges we have left is manufacturing a board and its pieces so that they fit together easily regardless of their
column3: > configuration. This was an issue in the last prototype because of a less precise cutting process
column4: > but we've since gone to laser cutting for a more exact cut, and have opened up the space in which the pieces will sit.  The people I have helping me with this are amazing, and I have full faith in their results!  Not to worry, your Rhythm Board will be perfect :)

column1: <div><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column2: >Marketing - Another challenge is marketing.  There are a few key music companies, teaching organizations, and Montessori suppliers that I'd love to work with, and I am confident that the Rhythm Board will appeal to these companies if I can get it into their hands. With your help, and my network within the music community, I will be able to get the Rhythm Board to these companies and give them a chance to see what a great product this is!

column1: <div>
Keeping it Local -
column2: >I am very proud that every detail of the Rhythm Board is made locally!  Every person I have collaborated with, from the printer and cutter to the videographer/editor for the video at the top of this campaign, is part of a small local business
column3: >.  I love that I know the person that slides the blank wooden sheet through the printer and that I'm the one who picks up the printed sheet and takes it across town to be cut into Rhythm Boards!

column1: <div>
<span style=""font-size: 24px

The Rhythm Board has come this far because of people like you who have generously given their time and energy to this project.  The most overwhelming support, in fact, has come from people who had no previous connection to me.  They believed in this product and have worked tirelessly to make it a reality.  Instead of giving funds, they donated services and expertise and have been the best cheerleading team I could ask for.

If you can donate funds at any level, thank you! - Grateful doesn't even begin to cut it!  If, however your donation is in time and energy, helping to spread the word about this great tool and promote it, you are joining a truly amazing team of giving and generous supporters that has been the heart and soul of Rhythm Board from the very start!

Thank You!

As I mentioned before, there are some amazing individuals who have gone above and beyond in their support for this project.  If you are in the Milwaukee area, I strongly encourage you to contact any of these people and businesses if you ever are in need of their services.
* Vera Brissman, Morning Star Montessori - Her stunning classroom, enthusiastic energy and the opportunity to work with her students were the inspiration for this tool.

* Dan Merkel, Design Build Workshop - Dan is responsible for getting this project off the ground and putting the people in place to make it a reality.  He did all the initial graphic design and measurements and introduced me to Scott, the guy who would be critically instrumental in the physical production of the Rhythm Board.  In addition, it was Dan's family that introduced me to the Montessori teacher and classroom that motivated me in the first place!

* Scott Anders, PSG Enterprises - Scott has undertaken all of the details pertaining to the actual production of the Rhythm Board: the printing, cutting and packaging.  He has spent countless hours and his own resources helping to make this idea a reality.
* Bethany Michaels, Flint Box Films - Bethany did all of the interview filming for this campaign as well as all of the video editing.  Her input and skills have been invaluable.

* Korinthia Klein - Korinthian Violin Shop - As a musician, teacher, Montessori mom, and friend, Kory has been my No. 1 guinea pig.  Every time there was a new change or detail, I took it to her first to get her honest feedback and suggestions.  She even had her kids play with it to get their thoughts!

* Travis Leanna, Milwaukee Strings Studio - Travis is my husband and has believed in me and supported this project from its very inception.  He has encouraged me when we hit snags in production or when expenses were looming, and he has celebrated with me when each new prototype got better and better and when we received our first financial endorsement.  
Thank you to everyone who has helped out with this project, the Rhythm Board owes its success to all of you!

Updates

Check out the ""Updates"" button at the top for more teaching videos and other updates!
","Our Goal

In anticipation of this campaign, we have begun fundraising among our family and friends and have already raised $1,450.00!  Our original goal was $8000, but in light of people's amazing generosity and excitement about the Rhythm Board, we've lowered our goal to $6,550.00.  Thank you to everyone who has contributed already, and thank you in advance for supporting this project!
What's a Rhythm Board?

The Rhythm Board is a tactile, puzzle-like tool designed to teach rhythm in an intuitive way.  The board and pieces are all made out of wood and are sized relative to the length of the note.  For example,  a quarter note is 1/2 the size of a half note, and 1/4 the size of a whole note.  The board itself has four 1-beat spaces on the top, and two 4-beat spaces underneath.  This way a student can begin with understanding how a single beat is made up and then how those beats are combined and relate to one another.  There are four full beats of each note, and each piece has the note on one side and its equivalent rest on the other, with bright colors to make the distinction clear for the student.  Because the design is simple, students easily grasp the function of each rhythm and the relationship of one rhythm to the next.

The Look  - The pictures here are of the most recent prototype, but look slightly different from the final product.  Because we have decided to go with laser cutting for precision, the edges of the board, spaces, and pieces will be black from where the laser burns the wood. It will not be available any other way, as cutting it with the laser is the best way to ensure that all the pieces fit easily and reliably.  Here's a sample of what the edges will look like
column2: I can't wait to see how the clean black edges look on the board itself!

column1: Who is it for?
The Rhythm Board is for anyone teaching or learning music that would like to have more fun and more success understanding rhythm.
General Music Teachers - instead of trying to write everything on a chalk board, the Rhythm Board can be held up and shown to the class at large, or given to individuals or small groups to work with.
Private Lesson Instructors - work one-on-one with students to teach a variety of both simple and complex concepts.
Montessori Classrooms - keep available for students to play with individually or teach other children what they've learned.
Parents - have at home as an introduction to music and rhythm for their children.
Students - use this during practicing to figure out rhythms in their music or to write their own music.
Short Summary - How the Rhythm Board Came to Be

As a violin teacher, I am always looking for the most natural and intuitive ways to help my students learn new skills and concepts.  As other teachers will relate to, whether working with very young students, middle and high schoolers or adults, there seems to be a broad sense of confusion about rhythm. This got me wondering if there was some deficiency in how rhythm was being taught.  Looking around,  the only rhythm teaching aids widely available were flash cards and black boards - tools that only encourage repetition.  Students needed an engaging medium that would convey the relationship of each rhythmic value to a beat and show how those values relate to one another and can be combined.

After visiting a Montessori classroom, I was inspired by their self-correcting teaching tools, and sat down to make my own tool I called the Rhythm Box.  I took it to my students and to the Montessori classroom and was blown away by how quickly students were catching on and how much they were able to figure out without any help!  Immediately my little box caught the attention of my students' parents and other teachers and they encouraged me to produce and patent it.

It's been almost a year since then, and my original rhythm box has become the Rhythm Board, and it is officially ""patent pending"" as of December 31!  My husband and I have funded all of the legal work and production so far, but to get the first run of products made I need your help!     What We Need & What You Get  Playing with the Rhythm Board guides students to the vital understanding of how each rhythm relates to the next and how they all relate to a musical beat.  My goal is to make the success I've seen with my students available to every music educator, parent, student, and novice.

I already have orders coming in for the Rhythm Board, but at this point, I have no products to sell. This is where you come in! Your financial contributions will pay for the Rhythm Board's first production run which will fill these initial orders in addition to creating a supply that will be sold through this campaign and commercially.  You will also help fund initial marketing and PR and advance future possibilities for the Rhythm Board.   I am already working with local music, educational, and toy stores to build a local awareness, but your help will allow me to get the Rhythm Board into the hands of larger, music-specific retailers who could introduce it to a much wider audience.

If we make our full goal, then I'll also be able to pursue other variations of the Rhythm Board.  The first would be a Rhythm Board specifically designed for Montessori classrooms - one that is more natural looking and includes a wooden tray so students can easily transport the board to and from their work stations.  I've also been approached about making a Rhythm Board app, which could really broaden the exposure of this tool.
What you get with your investment (Perks)
There are several ways you can support us:
$10 - THANK YOU!
$25 - Key Chain
INTRODUCTORY PRICE - Take advantage of a one-time introductory price and simply purchase your very own Rhythm Board!
$50  - Rhythm Board
$75 - Rhythm Board + Key Chain

SUSTAINING CONTRIBUTION - Choose to give a donation that will meaningfully drive the Rhythm Board's success by choosing a specific facet of its development to support. As a token of our thanks, you will receive a Rhythm Board and a key chain for your contribution.
$100 - Promoting to larger companies
$150 - Future product development
$200 - Current Product Production
$250 Video Production
$300 Business Affiliate
Anyone who receives a Rhythm Board will also receive a link to several teaching videos on how to teach various rhythm lessons using the Rhythm Board.  Lessons include:
Rhythm Syllables - How I use the board and rhythmic syllables when working with my students
Understanding Dotted Rhythms - Explaining how to count a dotted note
Understanding Note Names - Explaining why a quarter note called a quarter note
Combining Sixteenth Notes and Eighth Notes - Making subdivisions clear
Beginning Composition - Writing a song by ear onto paper
Playing Rhythms - Showing how a student works through a rhythm to be able to play it confidently on her instrument
Risks & Challenges

Fit - One of the biggest challenges we have left is manufacturing a board and its pieces so that they fit together easily regardless of their configuration. This was an issue in the last prototype because of a less precise cutting process but we've since gone to laser cutting for a more exact cut, and have opened up the space in which the pieces will sit.  The people I have helping me with this are amazing, and I have full faith in their results!  Not to worry, your Rhythm Board will be perfect :)

Marketing - Another challenge is marketing.  There are a few key music companies, teaching organizations, and Montessori suppliers that I'd love to work with, and I am confident that the Rhythm Board will appeal to these companies if I can get it into their hands. With your help, and my network within the music community, I will be able to get the Rhythm Board to these companies and give them a chance to see what a great product this is!

Keeping it Local - I am very proud that every detail of the Rhythm Board is made locally!  Every person I have collaborated with, from the printer and cutter to the videographer/editor for the video at the top of this campaign, is part of a small local business.  I love that I know the person that slides the blank wooden sheet through the printer and that I'm the one who picks up the printed sheet and takes it across town to be cut into Rhythm Boards!
Other Ways You Can Help

The Rhythm Board has come this far because of people like you who have generously given their time and energy to this project.  The most overwhelming support, in fact, has come from people who had no previous connection to me.  They believed in this product and have worked tirelessly to make it a reality.  Instead of giving funds, they donated services and expertise and have been the best cheerleading team I could ask for.

If you can donate funds at any level, thank you! - Grateful doesn't even begin to cut it!  If, however your donation is in time and energy, helping to spread the word about this great tool and promote it, you are joining a truly amazing team of giving and generous supporters that has been the heart and soul of Rhythm Board from the very start!

column59:
>

Hello. My name is Javier Starks, and I create the alternative. I expose youth in my area to quality positive Hip-Hop, repelling the negativity they are sure to encounter. The mission is to teach them that you do NOT have to be negative to be successful. By supporting this campaign you'll help us take positive music to youth all over the United States
column72:
/>

The People's Champ 

The following are the words of Laura Yee, current Lower School Principal at the prestigious Georgetown Day School in Washington DC:

""Javier is not only a dedicated member of our school community, but he also
exemplifies the type of role model we want for all our students. His open,
positive, and kind demeanor, love and respect for children and their
capabilities, flexibility, and creative capacities all serve as invaluable
assets to our school. I am grateful to have him as part of our community,
setting an example for all students - particularly students of color -
through his positive messages both as an artist and as a person. I have no
doubt that Javier's voice and music will impact our children and make
positive change in the world.""
column73: >A massive ""selfie"" I took with the graduating class this year at GDS, they show me so much love!

column1: <b style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)

With albums, shirts, posters and more, I'll speak, perform, and hold workshops at schools nationwide. We'll also be visiting youth organizations and performing at showcases along the way, connecting with as many people as possible! We're going to bring positive Hip-Hop to places where the very idea is obscure. Workshops not only teach the importance of positivity, but they'll also cover the basics of song writing, healthy social behaviors and universal life lessons. We're living in a time where there is an enormous mental gap between the teacher and the students. Students are influenced by pseudo rap gangsters who most educators don't even know exist. So I teach the students the importance of education AND, more importantly, the importance of being yourself! Imagine the ridicule you'd face being the ONLY student out of 1000 who's NOT so into the latest gangster rapper the radio's introduced. Parents take this for granted but kids are frequently ostracized and bullied based on their musical preference. Like clockwork, negative music creates negative situations, and shunning someone's favorite ""IDOL"" is likely to land you in the ""not so cool"" crowd. Peer pressure of this magnitude is usually unbearable, leaving targeted students with the option to conform or remain a social outcast. Some students figure they can at least ""tolerate"" the ignorant music and pretend to like the latest rapper for the sake of ""fitting in."" Not only do they subconsciously fall victim to the second-hand negativity, they're also enabling the destructive music by inadvertently condoning it. This is easily solved by giving them tasteful music that more than one group of people will love.

By contributing to this campaign you'll be changing the world,  LITERALLY. No need to wait for radio to adjust, no need for strict rules and regulations, no need for rallies or protests. We'll just provide a SUITABLE alternative to what they currently hear. They'll thank you for it, now AND later.
column5:
Life) is a youth organization I work for which is run by Mazi Mutafa. At WBL I teach the art of emceeing. This is one of my students.*

What It Will Take

We calculated a realistic goal of $30,000 for this campaign. That's what we'd need at bare minimum to take the tour Nationwide. With less we can still take the movement to new places. The reach will be limited, however. Likewise, if we exceed our goal the reach of the campaign will be extended. These numbers are based on the idea of me traveling alone. To bring a videographer or musicians along will require more support on your behalf! We can do it. I believe in YOU... thank you for believing in me! 

Let's take this global, we can literally ""CHANGE THE WORLD""... have faith.

column1: • Reaching the posted goal of $10,000 will allow us to take workshops to various schools in the DC area with stickers and CDs for teachers and students we meet! There's nothing more rewarding than seeing the smile on a child's face when you give them an autographed sticker or CD to take home! A signed business card usually blows their mind, but a sticker would be infinitely more effective =)

• Doubling the posted goal and raising $20,000 will give us the ability to take those CDs, stickers and workshops considerably further. Stepping outside of the Washington DC area, I'll be able to connect with youth and teachers in places like New York, Philadelphia, North Carolina. Out-of-state workshops and performances tend to leave a larger impact on young audiences. There's an added sense of mystery and mystique when youth are introduced to a presenter (or ANYTHING for that matter) that came from a place where they've never been. That in itself becomes a point of interest during the workshop. The phrase ""taking me places I've never been!"" begins to really resonate during out-of-state engagements. We'll also be able to add beautiful custom made t-shirts to the list of goodies to share!

• At $30,000 we're fully fit to start reaching youth nationally with CDs, stickers, t-shirts, posters and MORE on a literal ""path of enlightenment"", shedding light and knowledge of positivity the entire time! Reaching youth in places which may have never encountered true Hip-Hop, then eventually returning to Washington, DC where my very existence will shine as a beacon of success to the numerous youth who are likely to have never left the District of Columbia. What better way to inspire them to value their education? What better way to show them the value of social skills and critical thinking? There are so many other things that must be accounted for, so I was sure to leave some of the budget to cover those things. Gas must be purchased. Tolls must be paid, and the list goes on and on.

• I must stress again that this level of youth advocacy deserves far more than the ""minimum!"" This tour will change COUNTLESS lives. Anyone who experiences it directly will talk about it for years to come, I promise. My goal, however, is to leave an impression that lasts a LIFETIME. The age old question stands: ""If a tree falls in a forest and no one is around to hear it, does it make a sound?"" We want those who aren't there to experience the journey! We would love to document as much of the journey as possible. We'd love to share the vision with students and music lovers in other countries. Quality cinematic equipment is FAR from inexpensive, and to maintain the average person's standard of video quality we'd expect to spend $1500+ on the camera alone. That doesn't include feeding and housing the camera man for the duration of this bi-coastal journey. The trip itself will take anywhere between 1-2 months to run its full course and anyone who travels knows just how costly living on the road can be. It's absolutely vital that we keep in mind that the unexpected can (and quite often WILL) happen. A flat tire or ANYTHING of that nature can throw off plans severely when working with such an exact budget that lacks a cushion or room for adjustments. Nobody plans a trip to a foreign place with EXACT CHANGE. This should be no different.

    Currently we do not have ANY guaranteed press outlets or publicity agents. As a result, after reaching the $30,000 goal we will invest a small amount in different forms of advertising and press coverage to ensure that the world knows what's happening! To remove any concern you may have about the funds raised being used efficiently, one of my team members, a financial analyst, will work with me to manage the use of all funds raised. A financial report will be available for campaign supporters upon request.
column2:
>
No matter the challenge, we can do this!
column3: >""It takes a nation to raise a village""
column4: >. In 2012, the population of Washington DC was 632,323. Even with just $1 donations that's more than TWENTY times what we need. We can do this. No sweat.

column1:
The Perks

The motivation behind visiting schools and working with students should ALWAYS be to give THEM something, to leave THEM with new knowledge, to empower. That goes for any kind of educator, every subject, any theory. The prime beneficiary of this campaign will be the youth we meet along the way! The more we raise, the more we can do for the kids we'll work with! We've taken time to think of ways contributors can leave their own personal mark on history while helping a great cause AND snagging some priceless rewards in the process.
column3:
>
It's a Win x Win situation!

The biggest thing to remember is that we want to leave the kids something to hold on to. As a kid, how could you forget when there are stickers from the workshop on everybody's stuff? How could you forget when you have a beautiful painting hanging in your school's main hallway? We'll make sure that the kids never forget how the positive Hip-Hop made them feel. If we can get the entire school talking about positive Hip-Hop the kids will begin holding each other accountable!
column6:
>The Impact

I've come to realize that most people think that change won't happen unless it's something that BILLIONS of people join together to do... That is NOT true for popular culture. With popular culture, the most dynamic changes start with just ONE person doing something small yet noticeable. Everybody has influences, everybody has somebody they looked up to. Right now the youth want to be like the rappers they see on mainstream TV/radio... But there aren't any positive rappers in that mainstream arena. Nobody positive is creating what they seek while retaining a constructive perspective. WHEN this tour succeeds we will set a new example, and even if just ONE child decides to start being positive as a result, the cycle will begin to break. This list of organizations I've worked with grows constantly, and I strive to leave an open line of communication with the youth I meet via social networks. I've realized the kids only emulate what works. They need a reason to be positive. If they have someone who's not ""cool"" and or not ""successful"" telling them that they should be positive, they will turn away. They need someone who will show them the benefits of a positive outlook. When people have a positive outlook, they're more receptive to instruction, easier to connect with and more likely to be patient enough to process new information. Using positive Hip-Hop, we can bridge the gap between teachers and students, parents and children, the future leaders and the current leaders. I'm already doing it. Let's take it nationwide! 

Going Against the Grain

History has always (in its own strange way) rewarded those who travel off the beaten path. My story has been no different.  I may not be world famous or have my music spinning on the radio daily... but when I show up at the schools, and those kids smile... When I hear them cheer, when they unite and clap in unison... When teachers have to drag them out of the presentation room because they refuse to leave before they get the autograph or picture that they've waited so diligently for... That's when I remember it's worth it. That's when I know it's working. The best part about my plan is that I've already done all the leg work. If you Google me, plenty material will pop up. I've worked with INCREDIBLE musicians and artists - some known nationally, others known internationally, some approaching global status. No matter the song subject, no matter who I collaborate with, my contribution will always contain substance and remain curse-free, setting an example for my young fans!

The only risk I face with this plan is the possibility that the news of the campaign may not spread to the public. I admit, problems arise whenever I discuss expanding the movement, simply because people don't see the TRUE value in positive Hip-Hop. People are reluctant to help because they don't understand how Youth Popular Culture affects them. People don't take the movement seriously until they witness it first-hand. Teachers, parents, even government officials are often skeptical because this method is foreign to them... they've forgotten that in the beginning, somebody was able to bond with them through something that they were interested in at the time. They underestimate the power and reach Hip-Hop has... a culture that started in the slums of New York City which has now has spawned B-Boys, Emcees and DJ's worldwide recreating what happened when it all started.

Ironically, I get around these obstacles by doing more and more youth work. I overcome these challenges by making more songs and attending more community events. I make connections constantly, and doors open. I'm incredibly diligent. It will work.

Tell a Friend

Everyone assumes that they need some sort of extravagant or elaborate plan when it comes to spreading the word. We're all guilty of it... Start with your CLOSE FRIENDS and FAMILY. Even if you grandmother, aunt or uncle can't support, they just might tell somebody else who will. Have you ever noticed how when you're telling a close friend about something you're passionate about, you never have to ""think"" about the method of explaining it? Sometimes it just comes out as a jumbled pile of words mixed with smiles and laughter... THAT is more convincing than a 60-second spiel will ever be when talking to close friends and family... because your friends know that if it's something that YOU'RE passionate about, then maybe THEY should be excited about it, too. Good energy is contagious. My music is changing the lives of people who hear it everywhere. Be encouraged!

Share this campaign via email. Talk about this movement at work. Post this on facebook. Tweet the progress on twitter! Tell anybody you know who has kids, tell their teachers, tell your mentors, role models and advisers... The world needs to know. Be sure to use the IndieGoGo share tools!

THANK YOU ALL SO VERY MUCH. 

We're changing the world. LITTLE, By little.
