A passion for the advancement of women in STEM fields

All the executives work on a voluntary basis, contributing their time and money to the WAAW cause. They are all either women in STEM fields or women in education who see the shortage of women in STEM fields, the need to empower and encourage girls/women to remain or join in STEM innovations in Africa and who are eager to give back to the continent (Africa) they grew up in.
What our Scholarship program has achieved so far?
Since 2008, we have awarded five scholarships to African girls to enable them continue to go to school and get an education.
Lillian Kong'ani from Kenya
Chinenye Ezeakor from Nigeria
Celestin Tchande from Cameroun
Ashabe Katushabe from Uganda
Lorrine Maleya from Kenya
Why we need your help?

WAAW Foundation needs to continue this noble effort because most African girls do not have many opportunities to pursue their dream or have avenues to help them expand their horizons. Scholarship funds to support the education of college girls in Africa are practically nonexistent!

We are about to launch our 2012 scholarship program on August 1, 2012 but we need to raise $5,000 to ensure that the scholarship initiative can continue. 100% of all funds raised will go towards the scholarship funds. All donations are tax deductible. WAAW executives and scholarship facilitators work on a volunteer basis, many times donating their time and resources as well.
We can no longer sustain this initiative alone. The stakes are high and the demands enormous, so we are asking you for help.

Our scholarship program is aimed at providing timely financial support to academically promising female African Students who are currently in STEM related undergraduate disciplines in an African College or University. Awardees must demonstrate financial need and a strong commitment to participating in building Africa. The initiative also promotes peers networks that provide support and mentoring to ensure completion in their chosen STEM fields. Preference is given to girls impacted by HIV and in their early years of study.

We can no longer sit back and watch dreams crushed! Girls like Chinenye and Ashabe need help to ensure their education continues and is not stalled due to financial reasons. They want to graduate and get out of the poverty that plagues Africa, they want to be able to make a difference in the world. Education is the key that can make it happen for them.
How can you help?
To help us and these African girls, we need your help in various ways such as:
Making a donation to our campaign now.
Encouraging your friends and/or family to make a contribution.
Spreading the word by using the Indiegogo share tools.

Even the smallest donation will go a long way to help WAAW Foundation continue with its efforts to keep the dream alive in these girls one girl at a time. So even if we don’t reach our goal, what will be contributed will help in giving a girl a scholarship, if we exceed our goal, more girls will benefit from your generous contributions.
Prizes
Your donations will enable WAAW Foundation Scholarship to continue and earn you
A Facebook/twitter shout out from us and promotion in our newsletter.
WAAW Foundation T-Shirt (100% Organic)
Custom Handmade African print Wine Bag
A commemorative bracelet with your initials engraved (maynot be as pictured)
Hand woven Banana Leaf iPad Case
Beautiful Turquoise Hand woven plateau basket
Recognition as a WAAW Foundation Supporter.Three categories of WAAW Foundation Supporter:
$100+ basic WAAW Supporter
$500+ Gold WAAW Supporter
$1000+ Platinum WAAW Supporter
Automatic entry into the WAAW Foundation raffle tickets in which prizes currently include:
A three day/four night free stay in any Golden Tulip Hotel in West Africa (Accra or Kumasi in Ghana or Lagos, Enugu or Port Harcourt in Nigeria)
A two night/three day free stay in any Best Western Hotel in North America.
A spa/salon and facial treatment: $50 SpaFinder gift card to spend in over 7000 spas in the USA along with a hand woven unique bracelet made by Rwandan Women.
A $50 gift card to Target along with a hand woven unique bracelet made by Rwandan Women.
Four Free Movie Tickets to any AMC Theater.
Should you have any questions about our campaign or if you would like to find out more about our work, please do not hesitate to email us at editor@waawfoundation.org
Thank you so much from all of us at WAAW Foundation.
Ebele Agu, Media Director/CIO.",8.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Wylie, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/help-an-african-girl-achieve-her-stem-education/pica

Short Summary
More than 14 million children under 15 in Africa have lost one or both parents to AIDS. The Every Child is Our Child Program focuses on children made vulnerable by HIV/AIDS and works toward achieving universal primary education, fighting HIV/AIDS, reducing hunger and poverty, and promoting gender equality. This effort is guided by our partnership with the Queen Mothers Association in the Manya Krobo region of Eastern Ghana.

About us
The Unitarian Universalist Association (UUA) is a non-profit religious organization that supports Unitarian Universalist congregations across the United States and the world. We are a liberal religious tradition with a focus on social justice and activism. Learn more on UUA.org.

The Unitarian Universalist United Nations Office (UU-UNO) is the branch of the UUA that advocates to the United Nations. We lobby the UN on social and economic issues and work to raise awareness of important programs like LGBT human rights, women’s rights, climate change, and this Every Child is Our Child initiative.

In 2009, we supported the education of a group of 160 children who have lost one or both parents to HIV/AIDS in Manya Krobo, Ghana. Our partners the Queen Mothers provide the children's basic needs, like food and housing
column2: our office supplies all the other things children need to attend school: school and exam fees, uniforms, shoes, backpacks, pencils, etc.

column1: The money raised through this campaign will help us continue to support these kids!
What We Need &
We want to continue to support the children whose lives are being changed daily through care and education. Your donation will ensure we can still support their education.
When you donate, we will send you a thank you email acknowledging your tax-deductible contribution. See sidebar for other perks!

The Impact
When you give to this project, you will be making a significant difference in the lives of these children. You will allow them to get the education that can change their future.

Members of our organization recently visited Ghana. One of them described the experience: ""We were mobbed by what seemed to be a million smiling faces when we arrived at their schools the next day to see this project in action. We learned of their struggles: one computer for more than 400 students, buildings made of mud that could be washed away in a heavy rain, teachers who do not live locally due to conditions of extreme  poverty,  the need for meal programs, local libraries and more.  We met students who play soccer, who giggle and tell secrets., who want to be teachers, bankers, nurses, lawyers. They are bright, engaging and are just Iike the kids at our neighborhood schools in the US  They zoom outside for recess, they sing, they act in plays and they do homework…sometimes.""
These children need us - and you can help!

Other Ways You Can Help
Spread the word! Use Indidgogo's easy share tools to tell others about this work via Facebook, Twitter, etc.

MY NAME IS GARY STAPLE, AND WOODWORKING IS MY PASSION.

Ever since I started as a carpenter in my twenties I knew I had found my calling. I learned my trade the old fashioned way, from working under a few well seasoned carpenters. I picked it up quickly, reading everything I could get my hands on. I went on to start a successful contracting company in partnership with a friend. I decided after a couple of years I wanted something more. I found the best Furniture and cabinetmaking school I could find and decided to go all in. I sold all of my worldly possessions, including a house my brother and I had been restoring for the past 3 years. I landed in Scotland at the renown Chippendale International School of Furniture. Here I feel as if I have flourished as a craftsman and designer, honing my skills to a fine point. Unforeseen circumstance have run me into a finical wall. I'm 10 weeks away from graduating, and I need your help! I'm so close! 


I just need to cover my living expenses until my graduation in June (two months). This funding will cover my rent, food and transportation to and from school. It breaks down in the following way

With your support I will be gratefully sending out unique hand made items for you to enjoy, or give as awesome gifts! All my perks are valued at the suggested donation, and all lovingly hand made by me!! 

If I end up going over my goal, I will be using the money to set up my business
Setting up a press release for my return home. 500£
Shop space 800$/month
Tools &

I do not only intend on setting up a small woodworking company with this education, but ultimately to start my own school of woodwork and furniture making. I believe I can use my talents to give people a unique educational experience.

I understand if you are not able to make a donation, but you can still help!! Just by sharing this campaign, and getting the word out you will be doing me a great service! Don't forget to use the indiegogo share tool!

In 2014 the Flickinger Center for Performing Arts is celebrating our 25th year of continuous service to the community.  The theater has been supported by patrons and
local businesses through all its years, and there remains unlimited potential
for its growth in the future.
Thousands of talented adults and children have performed on
the Flickinger stage.  Last year about
6,300 children attended live professional performances at the Flickinger.  Local schools have used the theater free of
charge for musical and theatrical programs for many years.  These free performances are paid by
contributions made during our Annual Support Campaign.
The Annual Support Campaign funds allow us to share the arts
with local school children.  This year we
are using Indiegogo as an avenue to help raise funds specifically for helping
expose our local Otero Area School children to the arts.  For many of our local children we are their
only opportunity to experience live performances.  Please help us to continue providing this
service to our local are children.
We want to continue to provide life
changing experiences for local area school children and we need your help to do
this!
We want to offer yet another year of access to live
performances to our children.  We need
your help to do this.
The Flickinger Staff, Flickinger Guild, and Flickinger Board
are all comprised of local people with a passion for the arts.  Our goal is to continue to provide a much
needed exposure to the arts for our local youth.
Our goal to achieve our mission this year is $5000.
These funds would allow us to reach our children in a way
that is not offered anywhere else in our area.
The exposure to the arts is an important experience that inspires many
youth.  Our children need your help.
Local area citizens have helped for many years and continue
to help, however in order to continue to serve our growing number of local
youth we need to increase the level of community support year after year.  It is a struggle but we know that once our
mission is delivered to the public we will find the support necessary to
succeed.
Your gift will subsidize bringing children to special events
and pay the operational expenses of the theater.  Your donation to our local cause will go
towards transportation costs and performer costs for our youth
performances.
The Flickinger Center for Performing Arts operates with the help
of the following individuals and special contributors:
Flickinger
Staff:
·
Jim Mack – Interim Executive Director
·
Rashal McElderry – Night Manager
·
Jack Julian – Cleaning Diva
·
Jennifer Ham – Bookkeeper
·
Swan Colpitts – Administrative Assistant
·
Kelly Lynch– Technical Director

Board of Directors:

Selden
Deductible?
Yes, The Flickinger is a 501(c)(3)
organization.  We recommend you discuss

your benefit with your accountant.

Background

Mount Albert Grammar School began rowing in 1936. The school has won eight National Championship Maadi Cups (including the first ever raced in 1947) and has a rich history in the sport. Rowing was absent from the school from 1984, but returned in full in 2009 and for the first time in history had a girls crew in 2011. Now more than ever we need your help to raise funds for MAGSROW to get our rowers further with equipment, training and transport. Your donation, no matter how big or small will help us achieve our vision to once again be the most successful school in New Zealand Rowing.
Why We Need Your Help

Your donation will help our rowers in a number of ways. It will assist in buying new, and essential equipment for training our rowers including boats, rowing machines and Cox-boxes, plus maintaining them. We are up against schools with much more established rowing programmes but have already had great success despite being one of the under-dogs of the sport.
Also, the more we raise the more we can reduce fees so that students from all backgrounds can take part in what is an expensive but extremely rewarding sport.

The thing that sets us apart from other fundraising is the unique perks you can choose to the right of your screen. If you donate $25 you will receive a personal thank you letter from MAGSROW and signed by all of our senior rowers. For $50 you will get a 40-minute DVD of our 2011-2012 season with footage from multiple regattas and the prestigious Maadi Cup held in the South Island earlier this year. Finally for $150 you will receive an signed photo of our senior rowers for 2012. So with every donation there’s something in it for both of us, it’s a ‘win win!’
Our Impact

MAGSROW not only builds strong rowers but also strong men and women. Our core values are Hard Work, Perseverance, Respect, Honesty and Responsibility. Our mission is to consistently produce rowers who can succeed as individuals and as part of a team, at school level and beyond. So with your help we can continue to implement these goals in our expanding rowing squad.
Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can’t donate that doesn’t mean you can’t help. Please share this page and spread the word with your friends and family and also on Facebook and Twitter.
Thank you for any support
column2:
your contribution is greatly appreciated by all of MAGSROW’s rowers, coxswains, coaches, and parents.

Hey. Thanks for taking some time to read this - we really do appreciate it
Why is UnderstandBox a thing?

We believe that our educational system is broken - if we're not in the Top 5 Nations when it comes to education, we're not doing good enough. We believe that it's not the people behind it who are broken, but the mentality and the tools that have become tradition
column2: in the era of the tablet, does it really make sense to have students carrying around 50lbs of books? When electronics can be such useful tools, why do we keep chaining ourselves to the methods of the past?

column1: The UnderstandBox team hopes to change our educational future by changing how teachers engage with students and how students engage with education as a whole. More and more, we're finding that personalized teaching wins over standardization any day - but no teacher has the ability to tailor lessons and work for 150, 200, 400+ students.
We feel our solution is an efficient and elegant way to change that.
UnderstandBox is an idea
column2: we just want to help kids learn new and complex math concepts intuitively - and in doing so, fundamentally change how the STEM fields are taught. When high quality tools are put in the hands of subject matter experts, wonderful things happen.

column1: That's what our company is all about, and what this project funds: our very first step in that direction.
The UnderstandBox application suite: What does it do?

UnderstandBox is a program that is both available as a stand-alone mobile app and as a website application, for those students who do not have a touchscreen enabled device. It allows students to move around parts of mathematical equations to discover how numbers and mathematical concepts interact with each other. The actual math-solving (the ""heavy-lifting"") occurs in the background, thereby allowing students free range to explore.
The application will be able to handle equations ranging from basic arithmetic to Calc I in it's first iteration
column2: later expansions to the app will add more functionality. We have no plans to charge for updates to the UnderstandBox app - if you purchase it once, it should be free forever.

column1: The overall UnderstandBox website will add extra functionality to the application right out of the box
column2: teachers will be able to push equations to their students' applications, track time spent &amp
column3: concepts learned (with parental consent) and be able to collaborate with each other on creating tailored lesson plans.

column1: We eventually plan on adding in other resources for students on the website, such as pre-recorded and live instruction videos, as well as tying in other future UnderstandBox applications to make an entire educational software suite whose parts function either as stand-alone applications or as a whole, cohesive solution.
Misc Q&
Q: So wait, I'm confused. Who's paying for what when you hit the market?
A: UnderstandBox is, at it's core, a self-study tool with multiple value-add additions. The core application(s) of the suite would be what is purchased, with the Teacher &
Q: Will you allow for user-created content? (Plugins, etc.?)
A: Yes. We'll (of course) make sure to review plugins to make sure there's nothing wonky going on, but user-created content should be fine.
Q: So what will the final price be? And where do you go from here?

A: We were thinking a one-time purchase between $3 - $5.00. From here, we'd move into Chemistry, Physics, and we even have a rough sketch for a Literary learning app. No idea what we'd charge for those, though.

column1: We eventually plan on adding in other resources for students on the website, such as pre-recorded and live instruction videos, as well as tying in other future UnderstandBox applications to make an entire educational software suite whose parts function either as stand-alone applications or as a whole, cohesive solution.
Misc Q&A:
Q: So wait, I'm confused. Who's paying for what when you hit the market?

A: UnderstandBox is, at it's core, a self-study tool with multiple value-add additions. The core application(s) of the suite would be what is purchased, with the Teacher & User collaboration abilities provided free.
Q: Will you allow for user-created content? (Plugins, etc.?)
A: Yes. We'll (of course) make sure to review plugins to make sure there's nothing wonky going on, but user-created content should be fine.
Q: So what will the final price be? And where do you go from here?

A: We were thinking a one-time purchase between $3 - $5.00. From here, we'd move into Chemistry, Physics, and we even have a rough sketch for a Literary learning app. No idea what we'd charge for those, though.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Atlanta, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/understandbox-a-fresh-take-on-education-software/pica
